23340304.review:
Hero of the kingdom 2 is exactly as almost any 2nd movie is.

It's not bad, a lot is bigger, more skills/things to look for, more gold found/needed, more things to craft/use, upgrade, and all that, but in the end, the big issue this game is having is: Most have seen it in 1 before, so it ALL feels old, redundant.

With Hero of the Kingdom 1, I feel like the build up was better. You started out simple, and each time, you got a little more to do. Here, you very quickly get A LOT OF stuff, meaning you won't really find or familiarize yourself with anything. Quests left unfinished, and a sudden surge in gold needed (to buy a ship, or kill two dozen zombies, including maces, shields, blue potions, and a few soldiers). It leaves you uneasy.

In the end, this still has all the qualities of Hero of the Kingdom 1, and is a good game, but if you play this after part 1, you'll come home to a cold shower. I do not recommend it to those players. If you can get this game first, enjoy it, fall in love with it, then play part 1, and it'll probably feel like a warm familiar blankey on a chilly day, sitting on the front porch with a cold one. (I mean a sprite for anyone under 21 ;) )

23284606.review:
[h1]Mittelalterliches Point & Click-Abenteuerspiel mit Wimmelbildelementen und Ressourcenmanagement[/h1]
Wie schon im Prequel bewegt man sich durch die unterschiedlichen Ortschaften per Point & Click, wobei man mit verschiedenen Personen interagiert, Aufgaben löst, Ressourcen sammelt und verarbeitet. Im Vergleich zum ersten Teil hat man hier eine größere Gegend zu erkunden sowie teilweise komplexere Aufgaben zu bewältigen.
DIe Geschichte ist sehr unterhaltsam, abwechslungsreich, und die Suche der einzelnen Questteile nicht zu einfach. Insgesamt ein Spiel, das mir sehr viel Spaß gemacht hat.

Für die Jäger der Errungenschaften: Die Erfolge kommen im Laufe des Spieles teils (storygebunden) automatisch, aber größtenteils handelt es sich um Sammelerfolge und somit auch um [b]verpassbare (!)[/b]Errungenschaften. Daher ist es wichtig, ganz genau nachzusehen, ob man wirklich überall die Sammelobjekte gefunden hat [spoiler] Kisten, Schätze, Eier, Krabben, Perlen, Seesterne, Quest-Teile, Pilze[/spoiler], da man kaum überzählige hat, weshalb dann auch gegen Ende des Spiels über 15 Erfolge relativ kurz hintereinander kommen. Zudem sind nicht alle Objekte von Anfang an zu finden, da bestimmte Dinge erst erlernt werden müssen.

Hier sei noch erwähnt, dass auch der Erfolg "Namhaft (Erlange 300 Ruf)" daran scheitern kann, dass man nicht alle Nebenquests erfüllt hat. Sollte man am Ende die 300 Ruf noch nicht ganz erreicht ( 270 - 299) haben, dann hat man nach Beendigung der Hauptquest noch folgende Möglichkeiten -> siehe Spoiler[spoiler]Dann unbedingt nach Beendigung der Hauptquest noch einmal zum König zurück (25 Ruf) und zum ersten Dorf, damit man Hopson das Schiff schenken kann (5 Ruf). Dann das Spiel noch mal starten, damit der Erfolg kommt[/spoiler]

23227871.review:
This awesome little exploration / resource gathering/management game keeps the great things of the first installment and develop a new cool story with a few new features. These games are like a story that unfolds at your own pace. Here you won't find a lot of the structure you usually find in games like levels, time-based quests, the need to restart something... The challenge is to explore your surroundings in the best way possible with the resources you have, and work out your trades, purchases ans sales so you always keep the quests flowing. This makes for a very casual, fun and relaxing game, I really enjoyed playing both this one and the previous title. 

It seems that the type of game Hero of the Kingdom I and II are is kind if a new thing around. In the forums, people were asking each other for similar games but none was found. Props to the devs then, for making something so good and that wasn't out there already. Really looking forward to HotK III.

23180756.review:
[b][i]Hero of the Kingdom II[/i][/b] is a medieval fantasy adventure game. After your sister got kidnapped by pirates, you set out on the trace of their hideout in order to rescue her while travelling the land and seas and helping people across the kingdom.

[b]Pros[/b]: This game is exactly like its predecessor: a light straightforward adventure where you walk from location to location, gathering the items, money and resources you need to unlock quests and win fame points to continue on your path. As you do so, the map gradually unveils itself. One change, though, are the skills: there are more of them and they unlock all variety of an item type (many that are gathered on the maps "hidden objects" style) so the quantity of items feels much more massive than my memory of the first game. The setting also is and feels very different than the previous game, and you eventually travel to multiple islands in your quest to fight the pirates and discover the mystery behind their intention.

[b]Cons[/b]: The game is just as linear as the first one. There is little strategy save the order in which you accomplish quests, which merely require you to have the proper inventory to succeed. The crafting system is way too over complicated, 90% of the things you can combine and exchange for other things and items you'll barely ever need. Enemies and loot never regenerate, save the occasional animal hunting. There is no replay value to this game: if you played it once, you've seen everything the game has to offer.

[b]Verdict[/b]: ★★★☆☆ - It's up to you

This game is so much like its predecessor, in both mechanics, graphics and length, and gets a minor recommendation from me. However, if you didn't like the first [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/259550/][i]Hero of the Kingdom[/i][/url] game or were hoping the developers had up the ante, you'll be thoroughly disappointed. 

—————————————————————————
[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CJsOpinions/]reviews[/url].[/i]

23162049.review:
Однажды я прошёл первую часть этой игры и когда вышла вторая часть - я сразу же её приобрел (ну...почти сразу же...ну...ладно, по распродаже)
И снова начал гриндить, бегать по локам, искать эти проклятые скрытые элементы и снова бегать по локам, чтобы понять где гриндить и искать эти скрытые элементы.
Что изменилось относительно первой части?
Сюжетная линия стала длинее и даже чуть интереснее (хотя местами очень затянуто и лишне). В целом, ничего нового. Казалось бы, даже вещи, по сути, старые.
Что не понравилось - слишком много монстров, которых замучаешься убивать ради какого-то маленького и бесполезного сокровища. По сути, их можно не трогать, но...уж больно мне хотелось понять чем закончится это длинное подземелье.
Понравилось расширенное кол-во "скиллов", путешествие на корабле, война с пиратами, спасение принцессы и снова война с пиратами.

Короче, как и первая часть, мастхэв по распродаже. Эта казуалка вас затянет на несколько часов и, думается мне, можно  ожидать третью, четвертую, пятую, шестую и стопятьсотвторую часть, ибо ничего, слышите, ничего не меняется из части в часть ;)

23085435.review:
[b]Плывут седые облака в лазури высоты, 
Я, как мальчишка, погружен в мечты, мечты, 
И, изменяясь на лету, уходят облака в мечту, 
Они плывут как сны, точь-в-точь — 
В ночь, в ночь, в ночь.

Плывут седые паруса, торжественно-чисты, 
Я, как мальчишка, погружен в мечты, мечты, 
И, уменьшаясь на лету, плывут кораблики в мечту, 
Не в силах ветра превозмочь — 
Прочь, прочь, прочь.[/b]

[i]Представьте такую ситуацию: Вы – герой компьютерной игры. Неожиданно, не так ли? Не часто такое встретишь. У вас нет имени, но зато есть обворожительная сестра, с которой вы спаслись от землетрясения. Где это землетрясение случилось неизвестно, но очевидно там откуда вы пришли все погибли. О да, бывают в жизни огорчения. К счастью, на бочку дегтя всегда найдется ложка меда… или наоборот? А не важно! Так вот, местный рыбак, посчитав, что вы похожи на его давно почившего сына а ваша сестра… на домработницу приглашает вас пожить у него какое-то время. О нет, халявы не будет. Платить за жилье придётся хлебом насущным, попутно помогая встречным поперечным в их проблемах. Где гоблина надо прирезать, а где травки порвать. Ну вы знаете, типичные задания для любого геро… хотя нет, постойте! Вы же не знаете. Вы – герой компьютерной игры, а потому должны оставаться в неведенье о том, что будет дальше. Хотя мне думается это малость несправедливо, а потому скажу – страшные пираты похищают вашу сестру. Страшный некромант разгуливает в страшной канализации. Страшный демон пробудился из жерла вулкана. И наконец – страшная принцесса влюбилась в вас с первого взгляда. Нет, подождите! Принцесса не страшная. Просто наивная, как и любая уважающая себя принцесса. В общем страху на вас игра наведет лютого и главный из них: Достижения связанные с собирательством грибов, ягод и яиц, после которых вам скорей всего придеться идти к окулисту, так как зрение будет безнадежно испорчено. Жуткая картина, да.[/i]

Если же отбросить хиханьки да хахоньки, то перед нами достойное продолжение первой части, которое не изменилось ни на йоту, разве что прибавилась романтика пиратской жизни, а с ней и постройка своего собственного корабля… содержание которого обходится в «копеечку». Не важно.

Если же вам не довелось играть в первую часть, то скажу так: Это медитативная игра, способная скрасить пару вечеров, с достаточно наивным сюжетом и простенькими заданиями, которые связаны с пойди убей/принеси/укради/сломай. Без излишеств. Графика неумолимо напоминает «Героев 3», разве что бои проходят по схему – закупись ресурсами и вбей в землю все что стоит на твоем пути. Но в этом нет ничего плохого, ведь во многих RPGешках, будь то «Gothic», «Elders Scrolls» и в какой-то мере «Witcher» все это присутствовало и порой было куда интересней найти хорошо закопанный клад, нежели двигаться по сюжету, а здесь это было доведено до абсолюта. Разве что разочаровывает то, что предметы вы можете покупать лишь в количестве одна штука, как впрочем и продавать, отчего попытка «сыграть в еврея» превращается в увлекательное приключение на сроком в полчаса реального времени. Это немного портит общее впечатление, но с другой стороны, а кто говорил что будет легко? Так что если вас устраивает все вышеперечисленное, то можете смело брать игру… на скидки. Полной суммы она явно не стоит.

6 из 10 троллей просящих хлеба

23050259.review:
[h1] ひたすらにポチポチとクリックするのが楽しい、ポイント＆クリック型アドベンチャー [/h1]

海賊に誘拐された妹を探し出すため、冒険に出た少年が王国のヒーローに成長していくという王道ストーリーのアドベンチャー。

画面に上手く隠されたアイコンをクリックして「食料」、「木材」などのさまざまな素材を採集し、これらを必要とする人々と交換しながらお金を稼ぎ、クエストをこなしていくというゲームとなっている。

クリアまでの7時間あまり、およそポチポチしているだけのカジュアルな作品だが、これが意外と楽しい。
クエストに必要となるアイテムを入手するため、どの素材をどうクラフトし、どう資金を稼いでどう調達するか、というマネジメント要素を求められるのがミソか。


システム的には前作とほぼ同一だがストーリー的な関連がないため、2から始めても特に問題はない。
ついでにいえば、言語依存もさほど高くはない。
短いゲームなのでフルプライスだと厳しいが、セールであれば文句なくお勧め。

22055004.review:
I played the first one about 2 years ago. I enjoyed it, and I got 100% of the achievements. I recently got around to posting a review for it. For this sequel, I expected similar gameplay, but bigger and better. I wasn't disappointed.

Just like the first one, this is a casual game that plays like an adventure RPG, point & click, resource management, and hidden object all in one. The difference between the two is that this one has a much larger and varied world, more quests, more ways to "craft" and make money, and a bit more depth in the story. I'm very fond of the graphics, too. They have gotten better since the first.

For a game made by 2 guys (according to the About/Credits), this is a spectacular casual game. I wish there was some replay value to it, but there isn't really anything different to do once all of the achievements are unlocked.

Простая и незатейливая игра о от как добро побеждает зло. С технической точки зрения игра крайне неприхотлива и пойдет на слабом компьютере. Сюжет игры тоже прост, как любая сказка про нищих героев и принцесс.
Несомненно плюсы игры являются ее же минусами. Сюжет предсказуем и линеен, хотя для его выполнения понадобятся ресурсы и деньги сторонних квестов. В отличие от первой части, боев стало больше, монстры разнообразнее, особенно понравилось подземелье и новый навык-вскрытие сундуков. 21917323.review:
[i]Ty a tvá sestra jste při útěku před bandity nalezli útočiště v malé rybářské versničce. Jenže neštěstí nechodí jen po horách a tak vesnici přepadnou piráti, povraždí obyvatele a tvou sestru unesou. Jakožto starší bratr máš jistou zodpovědnost a tak nezbývá, než sestru najít. Vydáš se tedy po stopách pirátů, ale bez lodě to asi nepůjde. Co všechno budeš muset udělat, aby sis koupil či najl loď a sehnal posádku schopnou utkat se s piráty? Uvidíš...[/i]

Druhý díl stejně jako první díl vznikl pod taktovkou slovenského vývojáře Lonely Troops, kterou založili bratři Kurčíkovi. Jedná se o nenáročné RPG, které obsahuje adventurní prvky. Cílem hry je na obrazovce najít různé předměty a pro roztodivné postavy plnit úkoly a tím získávat zlato i slávu, která vám umožní posunout se v příběhu dále. Hra je postavena na vyprávění příběhu a vy si volíte cestu, kterou se ke konci prokoušete. Přesto je děj silně lineární a prakticky jen klikáte na obrazovku, abyste se posunuli k dalšímu úkolu. Ale sami si můžete volit, kdy který úkol splníte a jak k němu získáte potřebné vybavení. Na první díl hra vůbec nenavazuje, jedná se o jiný příběh, v jiné části stejného království.

Po grafické stránce hra nepůsobí nijak světoborně. Postavy jsou kreslené, stejně jako prostředí a žádné efekty v ní nejsou až na animace soubojů a úbytek zdraví. Ale hra také není postavená na grafickém oslňování náročných hráčů.

Hudba je monotónní, ale nijak neruší a spíše se v ní prosazují zvuky dokreslující co se právě děje (rybaření, lov, souboj).

Silnou stránkou hry je příběh, který je neuvěřitelně chytlavý a nutí vás pokračovat dál a dál. Ideální hra na tablet, nebo na nenáročný počítač. Vhodné pro děti, neboť je hra plně v češtině a neobsahuje žádný nevhodný obsah. Jako oddychovka se mi moc líbila. 9/10

21085647.review:
非常喜欢这个类型的游戏，我是直接玩的2代，准备入手1代也来玩玩。

部分隐藏攻略：通关后，可以继续play，还有别的任务，给声望，新的地图有上锁的宝箱可以拿，还有宝藏。

关于gold armor， 在那个有遗迹的地图，通关任务和捡到的4个石头（2个圆的2个三角的），放在祭坛上可以发现进入遗迹的入口。

还有300声望的成就，刚开始进城那个小男孩对话，扣声望没关系，还有后面给人买酒扣声望，都没关系，当然不扣更好。后面有足够的声望。我玩下来的声望是307。小男孩和买酒都扣了声望。

关于赚钱：可以买原木1个17金币，然后合成煤球10金币费用，卖给blacksmith得32金币。

玩这个游戏屏幕分辨率得大，最好1080P，否则在地图上找东西很费眼。

值得一玩，推荐！

20844327.review:
Well this game was surprisingly addictive!

When first loading this game I wasn't expecting a lot at all, I perhaps expected it to be a little time killer for a couple of hours only never to be played again. Well I was very very wrong. When I started the game I would be hooked for hours, not wanting to stop for fear of disappointing my people! The game has a kind of retro charm to it which brings you right back to the more simple times of gaming. It was simple enough to not get too frustrated with it and was also complex enough to not get promptly bored. The game in my opinion is well worth it's asking price and even though the campaign in only around 8 hours long, it keeps you truly entertained for them whole 8 hours.

20733596.review:
To me a surprisingly excellent casual point and click adventure. I have not played the first one nor am I deep into this one yet, but so far the "adventure" really works in this title and even though its resource management is not hard the gameplay is still rather captivating. There is just enough story that I find myself reading all of it but it does not bog the game down.

And as said, the Adventure part of this game works better than in vast majority of games I have tried in spite of the view and limited scope. Kinda blew me away how much it gets from how little it has to work with. Maybe I am just in the correct mood that it works, but nontheless highly recommended.

20674087.review:
[h1]Hero of the Kingdom II, sauvez votre soeur enlevée par des pirates[/h1]


Je ne sais pas si on peut vraiment considérer Hero of the Kingdom II comme un jeu d’aventure, car il a beaucoup d’éléments que l’on trouve dans un jeu de gestion de ressources.

Votre objectif est de récupérer dans ce jeu des ressources à un endroit puis de les revendre ou les échanger dans un autre lieu et ainsi de suite. Votre santé est aussi une ressource. Ramasser des baies, par exemple, vous fait perdre un point de santé que vous pourrez récupérer en dormant. Plus vous avancez dans le jeu, plus vous devenez fort et plus vous avez de santé. D’ailleurs, pour certaines taches, vous allez devoir être accompagné d’autres personnes, au fur et à mesure, vous vous constituerez une petite équipe.

L’histoire, vous (un jeune garçon adolescent) et votre soeur avez trouvé un refuge dans un village de pécheurs. Tout va bien jusqu’une attaque de pirates qui enlèvent votre soeur. Vous partez à sa recherche et vous allez mettre le temps qu’il faut mais rien ne va vous arrêter même si vous devez aller à l’autre bout du monde !

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=599108752

[url=www.graal.fr/2015/12/25/test-hero-of-the-kingdom-ii-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour lire toutes mes impressions sur Hero of the Kingdom II.[/url]

20637100.review:
Fantastic game just like the previous Hero of the Kingdom.
This game is essentially a combination of a hidden object point & click with elements of inventory/bartering. The story is about a lowly nobody who becomes the hero. I really enjoyed the soft music and the gameplay (involving buying/collecting items to advance the story).

I found the game to be difficult as collecting gold was almost a story checkpoint and 'farming gold' wasn't really an obvious option. Despite this, the long story and the little animated (simple) cutscenes that took place were enjoyable. There was more enemies to fight than the previous installment as well.

Overall, this game is a delightful experience 9/10.

20625041.review:
The sequel to Hero of the Kingdom that was released in 2013, Hero of the Kingdom 2 takes much of the same formulae as the original had, and improves upon them. For those not familiar with the first, Hero of the Kingdom takes the Hidden Object formula, and mixes it with RPG and Adventure to make a nice casual experience that allows the player to experience the game with little to no pressure. Allowing you to either sit down and clear through the game in one sitting, or to boot up and play the game when you have a little free time. Anyway, on with the breakdown analysis!


[b][h1]=Complete Review=[/h1][/b]  (TL:DR version and Conclusion at the bottom)

[h1]=The Story: 3/5=[/h1] The game starts with the protagonist and their sister wandering the countryside, looking for a place to call home. Their family, and their old home, were destroyed by a earthquake, with them being the only survivors of the event. They are found by a kindly old man, who takes them in and brings them to the fishing village he lives at. After running a couple errands, he comes back to the village only to find that pirates are raiding the village, and holding his sister captive. But before he can get close enough to his sister, he is knocked out.

He wakes up, only to find the pirates gone, and a couple of the townspeople badly injured. A trip to the nearby herbalist provides him with a couple potions necessary to tend to the wounded. Once he knows the townspeople are well, he sets out to find a boat in order to chase after the notorious pirates who have captured his sister.

Just like the first game, the storyline is that of a rescue mission. But, It has enough differences to it that it's not a sort of cut-and-dry copy of the original. The original is only referenced through a bit of obscure dialogue, so one could play this game without even needing to play the first.

[h1]=The User Interface: 2/5=[/h1] Same as the first game, as they yet again took a minimalistic approach. But I do suppose it works for the formula they went for, so I suppose they opted to not fix what wasn't broken, and instead put their resources to the art and gameplay. But fortunately, this means those familiar with the first game, will find absolutely no issue in navigating the UI.

[h1]=The Gameplay: 3/5=[/h1] Very similar to the last game, but there's definitely some improvement here. There's actual multiple ways to make profits should you run out of things that would be obvious to sell, as opposed to the single and extremely slow method in the first game. There is also other islands to explore, as opposed to a single landmass. There's also a new skill you can unlock, which is the ability to pick locks. Which is quite nice.

But, aside from that, things are relatively similar to the last game. In that you'll unlock new things to find as you learn new skills, of which these new things will spawn or activate throughout the world once you learn the skill, requiring a bit of backtracking to find everything. And interaction is done solely with a mouse, to click on objects to collect, exclaimation points to trigger quests, and on creatures to fight, so long as you've the items to fulfill the requirements.

[h1]=The Graphics: 3/5=[/h1] The graphics are well executed, everything containing a sort of consistant style so as to not make things look completely out of place, but also not blending completely in to the background. This can make things look as though they fit in their environment, but not insanely hard to find as well. Which is a problem I've seen quite a few Hidden Object games have.

All the art resources are also made by the staff working on the game, which is another such thing that I've seen games of the HOG genre cut corners on. So definite kudos to the artists of Lonely Troops. 

[h1]=The Audio: 3/5=[/h1] The music is quite nice, fitting the settings well. Obviously it's not the kind of music that one'll get hooked on, but it's definitely good to listen to for the duration that one is playing for. Sounds will also play depending on what is in the current view of the area, so you will definitely hear the difference between a bustling city full of people, and a forest stocked with wildlife and boar to hunt. 

[b][h1]=TL;DR/Pros & Cons=[/h1][/b]
[b]Pros[/b]
- Storyline is simple, akin to the first. A mission to rescue your sister!
- Easy to play casual gameplay.
- Graphics are well done, and don't look out of place.
- Music and sounds that fit the location.
- More ways to make money than the last game.
- Good amount of Achievements.

[b]Neutral[/b]
- Minimalistic UI as in the first game.
- Game is very casual, making it a boon for those who like it that way, and a strike against it for ones looking for more from their experience.

[b]Cons[/b]
- Game is short, just like the first game.
- Even more backtracking than the last.
- Little to no replay value.

[b][h1]=The Conclusion: 6.5/10=[/h1][/b]  It doesn't try to be groundbreaking or something overly different, it settles in to it's own element peacefully, while making improvements over the formula set by the first. It doesn't try to bring too much to the table like I've seen happen in other sequels, and what it does offer runs smoothly with absolutely no glitches or bugs. All in all, it's a enjoyable little game, and good to play for both people new to this series of games, and those playing this one after the first. 

I hear a third game is in the works already, and I'm sure that it will improve more over the formula as this one has. And I'll have to be sure to pick it up myself to play once it's released. But for now.... Thank you very much for taking your time to read my review~!

20372265.review:
After playing the first game through in one sitting I was keen to jump straight into Hero of the Kingdom 2 the very next day. What a great follow up in the series. 

I spent the day on and off playing Hero of the Kingdom 2 and thoroughly enjoyed my time on it. Once again I finished this game in around 6 hours inclusive of all achievements. The game surprisingly improved a lot when you took the time to look at it closely. No constant back tracking, solid progression and minimal "glass walls". 

Comparatively to the first game the money making options were improved, skills no longer advanced with training but new additions were added. A larger variety of challenges (easy of course but variety is nice). New and varied locations. Lastly, a little less cheesy towards the end but still fairly cheesy. 

Once again if I had to identify flaws, the lack of replay ability (in my opinion). The difficulty being too easy and possibly the simplicity of the story line and how by the numbers it is. I wouldn't hold that last one against the game though. It sets out to delivery another easy but enjoyable point and click / RPG / adventure game that is geared towards simple fun more than anything else. I loved this game. 8.5/10

20289043.review:
Kingdom of Wimmelbild ist eine Klickorgie der besonderen Art. Weder Strategie- noch Rollenspiel, ist es eher eine Art Adventure mit homöopathischen Schwierigkeitsgrad. Das Spiel besteht dabei aus Karten mit versteckten und markierten Objekten zum Sammeln von Material, Tauschen, Kämpfen, Ausruhen und Weiterem. Für jede Aktion sind vorgegebene Objekte erforderlich, die erst woanders gesucht, gekauft oder einzusammeln sind. Sobald man eine Produktionskette gefunden hat, deren Endprodukte teurer als die Herstellung sind, kann der Spielfluss auch rein durch Geld vorangetrieben werden.

An sich ein nettes Spielchen, ständige Fortschritte und kleine Belohnungen ziehen sich von Anfang bis zum Ende durch und motivieren für eine Weile. Allerdings ist das GESAMTE Spiel (incl. 100% der Achievements) nach ca. 6 Stunden vorbei. Der Wiederspielwert beträgt exakt Null. Deswegen und aufgrund des extrem niedrigen Anspruchs kann ich das Spiel nicht empfehlen. Wenn euch die vielen guten Reviews neugierig gemacht haben, dann hebt euch das Spiel für einen Sale auf.

20194586.review:
After seeing this on a winter sale, I decided to spend the four dollars and go for it. The game is a point and click adventure turned RPG set to a pirate-themed world. I would put "Hero of the Kingdom" in the same light-RPG flavor that made the original Pokemon games so popular: You're making progress regardless of the order in which you do things. 

The game is open enough and short enough to keep one's attention for a few hours at a time, which is a positive because there appears to be very little replayability. The collection quests work very well with the resource management, and there is never a sense of impending urgency to do plot points. I consider myself reasonably capable of puzzle solving; a 100% completion run took a little over 6 hours with no guide. 

Pick it up if you don't mind some gentle chiding from a game rather than direct scolding for failure. A word to the wise, this game does require a strong eye for details. If your eyesight or monitor resolution aren't the best, take caution. Other than that, it's a superb bargain-bin time filler on a rainy afternoon.

19895130.review:
So WHAT THE HELL IS IT? 
It's basically a casual adventure/puzzle/hidden object game. 

You follow the fantasy story with a hero, although you don't see him on the screen. You don't "walk" with him, just move between static 2D screens (with basicaly animated backgrounds and moving-arrows on the border of screen). You also collect resources, find hidden objects, but most of the time you're just trying to figure out what to do next.

Few important thing:
* it is VERY easy. You cannot die or get stuck irreversibly and you have always a hint available
* it's ok for kids, no cursing or brutality
* the gameplay is almost casual. I can imagine it could be well played on mobile phones 
* ..but having said that, it is FAR MORE complex and longer, than average casual game

+ / -
+ it has some very simple rpg elements (you don't have to get "lockpicking", for example, but if you help npc XY, you can learn it and make money that way. The same with Herbalism, Hunting etc..)  
+ 100% achievement easily reachable (and somehow fun to get)
+ about 5 hours gameplay
+ not many similar games around. The closest thing would be old point'n'click adventure games  (or hidden object games as "Abyss: the wraiths of eden") 

- story is a bit cheap
- absolutely zero replaybility

Can be finished with 100% achievements in about 4+ hrs, during one continuous play. 
I bought it for 4$ and yes, that's about worth it - can be surprisingly fun to play, if you don't expect much.

p.s. if you played first one, this is just more of the same.

19280791.review: This feels like an improvement over the first game, though when all is said and done there's very little changed other than the storyline and areas. It's an RPG without failure states where you mostly go around doing quests and clicking on small objects. The pixel hunting seems at least a little less tedious this time around, when it comes to achievements; eggs are more visible, mushrooms are quite common, though crates and barrels I did have to go and look for a bit. There's a few pixel-hunty quests too that aren't that great but ehh. I felt the storyline here was better than the last game, some plot twists, I think at least one minor character dies for real, among other things? Graphics and music are fine too. It's not a particularly deep game, but it's a fun time-waster and really surprisingly engaging. Not really something you'd pay full price for but if you can get it cheap or in a bundle then I'd say go for it. You don't have to have played the first one to be able to enjoy this one, either.

18970649.review: На мой взгляд, смена декораций на пиратские пошли игре исключительно на пользу. Все локации радуют глаз своей тропической красотой и проработанностью деталей. К сожалению, с первой частью игры сюжетная линия никак не пересекается, разве что в некоторых диалогах можно услышать пару фраз об похождениях нашего предыдущего героя. Как это принято в подобных играх, начинаем мы с пустыми карманами и никому не известны, а заканчиваем уважаемым спасителем королевства, владея тоннами всевозможных ценных предметов. Что касается достижений, мне удалось как-то сразу, по мере прохождения, собрать все грибы, травы, ягоды и прочее, не особо пристально прочесывая глазами экраны. В первой части с этим у меня помнится возникли определенные проблемы, когда после прохождения игры пришлось еще битый час выискивать на локациях недостающие предметы. В целом не разочарован и с удовольствием поиграю в следующую часть, если таковая появится.

18754516.review:
I was pleasantly surprised by Hero of the Kingdom II and having beaten the game with 100% achievements, I can say I would recommend this to other players. I never played the original game of the series, but I don't feel like I missed anything by skipping it. You might enjoy this game especially if you enjoy point and click puzzle games, but also if you like resource management mixed with a decently written story.

The game started off slow and I was worried the game would be too simple for me for to enjoy. However, after the game familiarizes you with the controls, your options expand and the real puzzle/resource-management begins. The game is divided into about a dozen main locations with several side-locations, such as caves and basements, that each have people in need of help or monsters in need of slaying. Monsters, as well as all quests, simply require you to possess a certain amount of items that you'll find through exploring or bartering. Many of the actions available to you are highlighted with buttons, but many resources are simply lying on the ground for you to find and harvest. Only rarely were the non-highlighted items difficult to spot, but I wouldn't be surprised if you missed out on one or two quests. You can never really miss a quest opportunity as it's available to you even after you complete the main story.

You'll quickly get into the flow of how to manage your resources and it did become a small grind for me. Thankfully, when I started losing interest, I saw the checkered finish line straight ahead and wrapped up the game nicely. The achievements were a breeze to get, but it did add some extra playability to an overall short and easy game.

I received this game in a Humble Bundle and hadn't heard of it prior to purchase. I'm glad I gave it a shot and I hope you can find the game on sale sometime soon as well.

18701644.review:
Kolejna bardzo udana odsłona gry o tym jak z prostego chłopaka stać się bohaterem królestwa oraz zyskać sympatię Króla i ludności. 

W drugiej odsłonie serii wcielamy się w rolę chłopaka, którego siostrę porywają piraci. My zaś aby ją odnaleźć przemierzamy królestwo walcząc z potworami, zjawami i zbójami aby pomóc napotkanym ludziom. Po drodze badamy jaskinie i krypty oraz odkrywamy nowe wyspy na mapie. Szukamy skarbów, zaginionych artefaktów, przeczesujemy rózne zakątki świata w poszukiwaniu wielu przedmiotów do odnalezienia. Z kupionych lub znalezionych przedmiotów możemy tworzyć nowe. W porównaniu do pierwszej odłony gra sprawia wrażenie o wiele bardziej rozbudowanej. Historia tu przedstawiona stoi na równie wysokim poziomie co w poprzedniej odsłonie. Natomiast od strony graficznej niewiele się tutaj zmieniło ale to nic, gdyż lokacje są ciekawie zaprojektowane oraz szczegółowe. Oprawa muzyczna została bardzo dobrze zrealizowana, zaś sama mechanika gry ponownie sprowadza się do wskaż i kliknij.

Ze swojej strony mogę grę polecić.

18666571.review:
前作と同じくクリックして行くだけの空気のようなゲーム。しかし、つまらないとも言えない妙な魅力があるのも確か。事実、このゲームの実績を見て見るとなんと50%近い人数がクリアーまでプレイしている事が分かる。それだけ簡単とも言えるが、クリアーまで5時間程度はかかるゲームを単に簡単だからと言うだけでクリアーまでプレイする人は少ないはず。なのでこのゲームには妙な魅力がある、その魅力は自分がプレイした後でも今一つ説明しづらいのが不思議ではあるけれど。

ゲームの中身としてはトレードゲームに近い、と言っても何を幾つ仕入れて高い値段で売れる場所で売ると言った本格的な物では無く、ある所で要求されたアイテムを持って行ったら別のアイテムを貰って、それを更に他に持って行くと違うアイテムを貰える、と言った形でわらしべ長者的にアイテムを増やしていくゲームになっている。それぞれのトレードは基本的にアイコンをクリックするだけで済むため、ゲームプレイは終始アイコンを追いかけてクリックしている事になる。
ただ、実際にプレイしてる感覚としては、様々なトレードを行う事で主人公の持ってるアイテムを増やしていく事になるので、RPG的な経験値稼ぎやゴールド稼ぎの様な感覚もある。実際ストーリー的には名も無き少年の立身出世物語であり、主人公の資産＝主人公の能力を向上させていくRPGとも言える。ちなみに、通常のトレードゲームのように金銭を介したトレードも可能で、それによって利益を上げていく事も出来るが、これは恐らく途中でトレード資産が無くならないようにするための救済措置だと思われる。

全編英語でストーリーは進んで行くものの、その英語は妙に簡単でまるで自分の英語力が上がったかのように錯覚できるほど。文章が全て教科書の例文の様な内容なので、これを英語圏の人が読んだらどう思うかは別として、英語を得意とは言えない人間からすると非常に分かり易くありがたい。ゲームシステム的にも全てのトレードはアイコンで表示されてる為、英語を例え読まなくてもゲームを進める事は出来る。なので英語という観点からはプレイのハードルはかなり低い。

前作と比べるとキャラクター表現が細かくなってたり、アイテムの入手法が色々追加されていたりと、RPG的な雰囲気作りは強化されている。それでもまだ薄い印象のゲームなのは確かだが、このままこのゲームが進化していくとどうなっていくのか、先が気になる程度には進化した。わざわざお勧めするには何かとらえどころのないゲームではあるものの、たまにはこんなゲームも良いんじゃ無いかと言う程度にはお勧めしておく。

18592838.review:
Zajímavá hra od pár lidí. 
Spousta úkolů má vícero řešení a je možné plnit úkoly v různých pořadích. Na což využíváte nejenom předměty, ale i životní sílu, která se získává spánkem a sčítá se, když spíte vícero nocí po sobě. Spánek v posteli je samozřejmně lepší, nežli u ohniště.
O předměty se nemusíte bát. Pokud nejsou důležité (tedy po úvodní tři obrazovky), tak se dají opět koupit jinde. A pokud nebudou zlaťáky, dají se vydělat. (Shodou okolností jsem si vybral snad ten nejpomalejší způsob jak si vydělat peníze. A klikat jednou za sekundu, až jsem klimbal mne moc nebavilo. Lepší způsoby jsem našel později.)
Pro sběr některých předmětů potřebujete se nejdřív naučit jak na to, což vás naučí jiné postavy za splněné úkoly. 
Takže plnit úkoly, časem vše co vidíte, a budete zrázu na konci a ještě mít všechny achievementy hotovy. 
Pěkný byl styl vyprávění. Připomněl mi, jak jsme řešili kdysi obdobné věci na dětstkých táborech při hraných scénkách.

Celkově mi přišla hra jako pixel hunting často. 
Nebo když už jsem z vody vytáhl jednu věc, najednou jsem se naučil jak sbírat jiné z vody a nové obrázky se objevily, které tam nebyly až jsem zoufal, že né, zas ta voda. 
Romantická zápletka mi přišla moc jednoduchá a zbytečně na větách klišovitých a krapet tupých snad až.

18555692.review:
[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*][b]Game Name:[/b] Hero of the Kingdom II
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2015
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] RPG; Point & Click; Casual; Adventure
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] B
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 5-9 hours
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] None
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Casual gamers
[/list]

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
[b]Hero of the Kingdom II[/b] is an interesting thing.  The game style blends elements of point-and-click adventure games, resource management/economy games, and role-playing games.  It is extremely casual and relaxing, but also is rewarding.  It is by no means an epic, immersive, high-budget AAA title, but it is a great casual experience for those who would appreciate it.

This is the sequel to the original game in the franchise, [i]Hero of the Kingdom[/i].  It is essentially the same game as far as mechanics and gameplay go, with only very minor differences.  This game has a more elaborate storyline and is longer, but it is still an extremely simplistic and casual experience (like the first).  The narrative is not a direct sequel, so you do not have to worry about playing this game without playing the first.  

The game plays as a point-and-click adventure, essentially— with an inventory and a narrative.  In order to progress (i.e.: complete quests) you must pass inventory checks that determine if you have enough of specific items.  Thus, playing the game boils down to growing your inventory in two ways.  By finding camouflaged objects on the screen and clicking on them.  And by bartering with the NPCs; there are numerous profitable NPC-trading loops that can be used to make money and buy inventory items you need.

The narrative is extremely light; there are very few total lines of text.  While it isn’t [i]bad[/i], it also is easily forgettable.  But it does a good enough job creating a feeling of advancement and incentive as you complete quests.  There are also a lot of well-spaced achievements (both in game and on Steam) that pop-up often to keep the game feeling rewarding as you progress through the campaign. 

For those who seek more intense gaming experiences, you may find this game somewhat tedious.  However, if you like tranquil, addictive games that are rewarding, there is a good chance you will enjoy [b]Hero of the Kingdom II[/b]; and will probably like the first one as well.

[i][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/murphyslawyercuration#curation]Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations![/url][/i]

18181762.review:
[h1]Short version: 73%[/h1]
Hero of the Kingdom II provides the exact same adventure/hidden object/resource management gameplay its predecessor did, but somehow it cannot capture the charm the old game brought to us. It’s an inferior sequel, but still a damn fun indie game.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Hero of the Kingdom was one of the surprise indie hits of the recent years: a game that combined the classic adventure formula with hidden object mechanics and resource management. Mostly the latter, because the goal was always the same: use your current stocks to gather enough of the specified resources to pass the current objectives.
The second game didn’t change anything about this formula, it only tried to tweak it a little with small things like unlocking all skills and the city early to avoid the constant backtracking.

Still, it somehow misses the soul of the original. Everything feels a little worse. The plot is more amateurish. There is no real progression, you can just visit almost entire map right away– which is significantly smaller, despite the inclusion of in-door sub-maps. There are no side-stories; people just dump their sub-quests on you as soon as you enter an area.

I’m not saying the game is bad; Hero of the Kingdom II is a very enjoyable indie game worth every penny. But it just cannot hold a candle to the original.

18165149.review:
Surprisingly relaxing and enjoyable little adventure game. 

Hero of the Kingodm is a kind of ligthweight mix of point and click, resource management and treasure hunt but it's put together very neatly. The game is well paced in regards to story progression and character development. There's also enough variety that you never feel like you're doing chores. You're always helping someone in this way and that or gathering enough resources to be able to get to to where there's obviously something interesting. There's never any grind and it's easy to tell when you're ready to tackle the next big obstacle. There are a handful of secrets/optional things to get, but theyre kinda obvious and you will most probably mop them along the way if you're at least a little observant :)

The story may be a bit tropey but it's enjoyable and fits well with the theme and still manages to pull a little twist at the end. 

I'd recommend this game if you're in for a quiet evening. Possibly get it in a sale :)

18006498.review:
Hero of the Kingdom 2 is a slightly better version of its predecessor. If you like casual adventure games then you will find about 5 to 7 hours of enjoyment here. Bottom line: Pick this game up if your looking for something to mindlessly occupy your time for a lazy afternoon. 

Just like Hero of the Kingdom 1, HotK2 (that acronym sound like some BA skis) is a click your own adventure. This time around the there is more crafting, more collectibles, more quests, and infinitely more clicking. I have to be honest, the clicking is ridiculous! Example 1: Some of the game is a lite version of hidden object where you have to find say, eggs. You click the eggs, an animation shows the eggs being taken, then an icon of the eggs appear and you must then click the icon of the eggs to obtain them. Given the fact there are about 1,000 hidden objects in the game that's 2,000 clicks you have to do! That's just one example. Most tasks within HotK2 requires 2 to 4 clicks to complete. This was a problem in the first game, only it feels like it's gotten worse. This is probably due to the extended length of the game.

The writing has improved over HotK1. Now instead of the storyline reading like it was written by a 12 year old boy and edited by a 6 year old girl, it's more like a 16 year old boy wrote it and was edited by a 14 year old girl. Grammar has improved. Spelling errors were down. The general story was more in-depth. However, like I said, it's still juvenile, just less primary school. There will be no awards for storytelling here, but you'll be less apt to skip over all the story as in before. 

The game as a whole is fun! The constant clicking, predictable story aside, HotK2 has a way of pulling you in and making you want to complete every facet of it. I grabbed this up for $3. For 7 hours playtime with 100% achievements, I feel like it was a good investment. If you're looking for something that can waste away a rainy day, you've found it.

17695848.review:
Voto 8/10

Scoperto per caso il primo capitolo che alla fine si è rivelato interessante (assolutamente slegato da questo se non per alcuni "easter eggs"), ho aspettato questo secondo capitolo con una punta di attesa e non mi ha assolutamente deluso, anzi.
Come per il primo capitolo il gioco in sé non è assolutamente complicato, forse un pelino di più se volete completare gli achievements cercando tutti gli oggetti e finendo tutte le quest, ma niente di impossibile o frustrante, semplicemente lo rendono più interessante.

Il gioco è di base un'avventura, ma fruita in maniera differente dal solito. Ovvero affronterete le varie quest dovendo cercare alcuni oggett/persone, e questo può essere fatto in varie maniere.

La prima è interagire con le icone che sono ben evidenziate nello scenario. Qui probabilmente dovrete avere nell'inventario altri oggetti che vi permetteranno di interagire con essi: ad esempio per raccogliere dei fiori dovrete avere comprato/trovato dei sacchi e un falcetto, magari comprandoli dai venditori o trovandoli come ricompensa in altre quest.

La seconda è cercare gli oggetti nello scenario, tipo "oggetti nascosti". Alcuni oggetti compariranno man mano che diventerete più bravi in alcune skill. Ad esempio i funghi non copaiono all'inizio, ma solo dopo che un certo png, come ricompensa per averlo aiutato, vi insegnerà a trovarli, e così via per altri oggetti. Questo sistema funziona anche a volte per trovare oggetti/persone smarrite, e l'unica indicazione che avete è quella di seguire le indicazioni contenute nei testi e aguzzare vista e ingegno (niente di complicato comunque). Anche la caccia ai tesori funziona in questo modo.

La quest principale va avanti da sola, alla fine si tratta solo di avere il quantitativo giusto di oggetti richiesti per fare quell'azione: ad esempio per fare una certa battaglia avrete bisogno di un tot di soldati, pozioni etc. Stessa cosa per aggiustare strutture rotte etc. La cosa più "complicata" è ricordarsi chi vende/compra cosa e dove. La storia è bella anche se non c'è niente di mai visto, interessante e raccontata bene. Forse ci si immedesima poco nel personaggio dato che non lo si vede.

A differenza del primo ci sono più cose da fare, da cercare e da sbloccare, e risulta tutto più vario. Bella la parte di dungeons sotto la città e di varie grotte e passaggi sparsi qua e là.
Mi è piaciuta l'ambientazione piratesca, e la solita evoluzione del personaggio che diventa pian piano eroe.

L'audio è di contorno ma non da fastidio, le musiche dipendono semplicemente dal posto in cui siete in quel momento, fa il suo dovere.

Graficamente è piacevole, e a differenza del primo che era generalmente molto statico, qui ci sono più animazioni degli ambienti e dei personaggi, e generalmente sono più curate e fatte meglio.

L'avventura è breve, si finisce in poche ore come il precedente, anche con quest secondarie, caccia ai tesori e achievements compresi, ma tutto sommato si vuol vedere come finisce o come va avanti, e finire tutto gli achievements è gratificante senza essere frustrante, penso che sia molto positivo.
Credo che valga la pena giocarci comunque, soprattutto se preso non a prezzo pieno.

17665160.review: Первую часть игры я изначально спиратила у Алавара. Всё, что обычно у них бывает, к сожалению, не стоит запрашиваемых денег за редким исключением. Такими исключениями были серии менеджеров Royal Envoy и Green City, по-настоящему рисованные "поиски" и игры, не вписывающиеся в рамки обычных предложений Алавара - Hero of the Kingdom и Braveland. К сожалению, последние разовы и обычно продолжения не имеют. Как же я удивилась, увидев в Стиме продолжение к игре, которую прошла пару лет назад и расстроилась, что больше таких нет! Могу сказать, что с радостью вернула разработчику HotK деньги за первый экспириенс и с удовольствием заплатила за второй. То же самое потом случилось и с Braveland.

17663713.review: Like part 1 (which uses the same engine), this is a mixture of point-and-click adventure, story book, resource collection and management, and "hidden items" game, all rolled into an interactive story with no forks in the road (i.e. linear). The peaceful music, intuitive interface, and beautiful graphics all make for a pleasing, casual game experience with no time stress. There is no loading and saving of games because it doesn't need it - you only have one game in progress and it's saved after any action (changing areas, buying or selling, etc.). As far as i can determine, it's next to impossible to get it into a state where one neither has no can obtain more money, and thereby gets stuck. This edition is larger than part 1, but in terms of map size and things to do, but is, in terms of usage/play, identical except that this one includes some underground areas which do not show up on the world map. The continual back-and-forth between the islands and the town, for fighting supplies, got a bit tedious/annoying, but didn't go on for too awful long. If you enjoyed part 1 and want more of the same, grab this. If neither of those apply, don't.

剧情好长，而且很中二，也很狗血，不过算是个好故事
地图扩展的速度比一代快了很多，导致一开始没办法记住所有地方可以交易的东西，让我以为自己卖了不该卖的任务道具，又从头玩了一次……

多出来的地下部分算是不错的创新，不过这导致游戏整体流程过长，初代的长度感觉正好，而这个曾经有好几个地方都让我感觉“该结束了吧”，然而并没有结束

其他的像是撬锁技能之类，因为游戏表现方式的缘故，并没有太多新意

找东西的难度很微妙，有些东西（任务物品）藏得十分隐蔽，甚至偶然点到了都不知道具体在哪
而其他成就相关的收集比一代要简单一些，让我这种盲人也能全成就

初期发展经济的策略与一代相同，不损失在地图上限量得到的东西的前提下，面包的循环交易是刷钱效率比较高的（不过加工出一袋面粉的价格虽然没变，但得到的面包少了一个，也就少了不少钱）

到了后期船差不多造出来的时候，可以联合刷面包和火药桶（莫名有种侯氏制碱法的感觉），虽然整个过程中用到的东西会涉及到6、7个场景，但是刷钱的比率比较高

总之还好，如果有续作最好能放慢一下发展节奏，并控制一下整体长度。

17228762.review:
I vaguely remember playing through [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/259550/]Hero of the Kingdom[/url] about a year ago. It was a blast of casual RPG adventure and I played it through in a couple of evenings. The second instalment is best described to the players of the original game by "more of the same": Light-hearted adventuring in a fantasy-lite setting, being a goody-goody adventurer who has great deeds in his near future. I'd roll in a casual take on the hidden object genre as well.

Storyline is also fairly similar to the original: the protagonist has basically lost everything but he's an honest, hard-working dude so he's not complaining and instead just starts getting stuff done. Then everything goes down the drain again and he has to go save not only his sister but basically the whole civilized world. Being the embodiment of righteousness he's going to help every beggar, farmer and sovereign along the way, even the shady kinds because of "the greater good".

Game mechanics are also familiar. To do stuff the protagonist has a bunch of properties like health, fame and money that he uses to get the dirty business done. Most of the work you can do is clearly shown on the map, and this includes talking to people, trading or doing quests. Usually business takes its toll in the form of reducing health, tools or some of the items the protagonist hoards and hauls around everywhere he goes. You will learn that, controversially, eating different foods and sleeping in quirky places makes you stronger. You've also got abilities (like fishing or foraging) and areas of knowledge (like pearl diving) that allow you to do more stuff on the map if you've got the right tools.

The areas of knowledge allow you to play a kind of hidden object minigame. Take the example of the pearl diving: when you learn it, a bunch of seashells with pearls inside them appear in the water areas. Clicking them gets you pearls. Unlike quests, these are not highlighted but they also don't require any additional tools to collect. Merciful for achievement hunters, there are always couple more than required of each object on the map.

When doing dirty business, all that is required is that you have enough health, money and whatever else is required for the quest. There's otherwise no chance of failure (but your tools sometimes break afterwards). Because of this the story can progress at a fast pace. I think I only had a short pause on progression when I found that I could break the economy by producing ridiculous amounts of flour and later lumber and trade them for surplus gold. The resulting several thousand gold coins made sure that I didn't need to care much about money for the rest of the game.

It took me couple of evenings, i.e. about 6.5 hours to finish the game and find everything for the achievements. I had to keep it rolling for a couple of extra hours for the last cards.

Hero of the Kingdom 2, like its predecessor, is really a game of happy thoughts. Curious how being a fictional goody-goody guy is able to arouse a nice, warm feeling inside of you. Both games would probably work well playing with a child, even more so if they can read. While I got mine on sale I would even recommend this game for the full price: that's how nice it was.

17221689.review: Простенькая игра в духа hidden object разбавленная простыми квестовыми заданиями. Видно что сделано с душой, проработано до мелочей. В общем отличное развлечение на вечер, рекомендую.

17139058.review:
First of all, as many other reviewers already stated, this is a purely casual point & click game, so move along if you are expecting anything else. But as simple as it is, it's still a very good game if you want to just relax and take your mind off things.

Pros:
+ Very simple gameplay, fitting for all ages. Basically, all you do is click on things. I don't think there is a way to fail in this game.
+ Smooth gameplay. There are no situations where you are stuck in the storyline because you cannot find a tiny little thing on a screen or failed to pick up some item several hours ago.
+ Addictive enough to get you through the story.
+ Original. You don't find many games of this type nowadays.

Cons:
- Mediocre writing. You won't find any interesting dialogs or item descriptions here.
- Very, very cliched story. If you got a hero story cliche in your mind, you are likely to find it here.
- Very short. It took me 7 hours to finish the game and unlock all achievements, but 2-3 hours out of that time I was away from my PC.

Overall, I recommend the game to anyone who just wants to relax in the evening and get a change of pace. Even though it is short, making it any longer would probably bore people out of clicking.

15617184.review:
I picked up Hero of the Kingdom 2 because I enjoyed the first game so much. The independent developer really brought more to the game this time with more maps, more things to hunt for, and challenging achievements that were fun to pick up while playing through. 

The story was engaging enough to stay interesting and while the game has little replay (unless you're going back for missed achievements) it is an excellent casual game to spend some time playing here and there.

In the first Heroes game you got about four hours of gameplay from start to finish with 100% completion and this was almost double the time thanks to added content. The flow of the game remained smooth and didn't present an issue, at least to me, when backtracking to pick up items needed to fulfill quests.

One note I would recommend for the developers is an active quest log that tracks the items you need. That was the most cause of my backtracking at times - to see what items I still needed. 

Overall, fun game. Very casual and worth a play.  The price point is about spot on for what getting what you pay for and any deal that gives it more than 30% off is a steal.

15611246.review:
I like the style of the Hero of the Kingdom series. When I played the first one, it took a bit getting used to, but being able to move all over the map with a few clicks makes going back and forth to get things to solve a quest so much easier than any 3D adventure game where you have to walk or run to get around. 

Just like its predecessor, your progression through the game is relatively linear, and though it is not strictly speaking necessary to win the game, it does give one a certain extra satisfaction gaining all the achievements, which is possible to complete after reaching the winning conditions of your main quest and storyline. Judging from the global statistics, rather a high number of players actually choose to complete all achievements, which is an achievement for the game's creators.

Speaking of story, it is your typical slightly clicheed fantasy adventure story, where even the twists are hardly surprising, though a nice touch to what would otherwise be a bit too predictable. Still, its familiarity makes the game a bit more casual, which suits it nicely.

Like in the first instalment of the series, a bit of bartering might be necessary to reach the funds needed to achieve all goals. I assume that hardly anyone plays this without having played the first one before, and so I'll not say any more particulars about the game mechanics.

I felt that what you had to do in this game, though of course similar to the first one, was sufficiently different to make it feel fresh and fun again for the 4 hours or so that is needed to complete the game. My playtime ended up being a bit longer as the game was left on when I was AFK, and also I had to find those last hard-to-spot eggs and lost crates to complete my Steam achievements as I was so close at the end of the game I thought I might as well.

Coming from a 1920x1080 15 inch display laptop, I felt that the things you had to find were slightly easier to spot in this one than in the first game. Perhaps a tad bigger or clearer, whereas the individual blue mushrooms of game one left me looking a bit longer.

All in all, this game was more similar than different from its older brother, and think that's a good thing. It dares to be different, and manages to go against the trend of over-production that has crippled the gameplay of some adventure games over the last few decades, though it is by no means retro in its use of graphics as there are hardly any visible pixels in sight. 

The simplicity of its user interface might seem to belong to a different era, but I think it makes for highly playable and enjoyable minimalism, making a game that I feel is well worth the ticket price.

15100702.review:
Just like its first part this game is a fun to play point and click game, although I completed it really fast. It took me 4,5 hours to get to the end, then I went for the achievements and also completed them very fast as you can see. 

In the first part it was just a small world to explore if you compare it to this one. It took me more time to learn all the skills, so I had to go several times to the same place, first to pick mushrooms, then to find eggs etc. Just before the end, when I got achievements for finding a lot of eggs, and killing lots of wild animals, I noticed that when I got the master achievement, there still were some eggs to find (probably other stuff too, but I noticed the eggs). In the first part, when you got the master achievement there weren't any eggs left, so that's a little change. Nice for when you're short on money.

The whole map was used in a nice way, land above and islands below. The storyline was a bit better than the first one in which you had to defeat an evil wizard to save the kingdom. This time I had to find my sister, I found her and also my brother who left a long time ago, but got possessed by the devil and became a pirate because of that. Then I got a wizard by my side and had to defeat that devil and its creatures.

As opposed to the first part it was a lot harder to obtain the items needed, because during the first part I created the habit of selling almost everything I had, since I wasn't going to use it anymore. Due to that "bad" habit I often had money problems during important (and expensive) missions, but I made it!

Just as its first part it's just a game to play when you have spare time and you don't know what to do with it. Also perfect for the beginning achievement hunter.

15093332.review:
Riporto la mia recensione di Hero of the Kingdom:

" Hero of the Kingdom è un'avventura punta e clicca con elementi RPG di fattura semplice, ma non per questo meno bello.
Con il sequel in arrivo tra febbraio e marzo 2015, consiglio questo gioco a tutti i fan del genere, a tutti coloro che cercano un gioco rilassante e una bella avventura, ma anche a chiunque abbia qualche soldo da spendere e trovi il gioco in saldo.

Pro:
- Durata di 4-5 ore perfetta per la tipologia di gameplay
- Splendida grafica disegnata a mano
- Ottima colonna sonora
- Storia interessante e coinvolgente
- Gameplay spezzato dalle numerose missioni secondarie, fasi di commercio e fasi di ricerca oggetti nascosti per la mappa
- 100% achievements abbastanza facili da ottenere
- Carte collezionabili
- Praticamente esente da bug

Contro:
- Poca rigiocabilità dovuta alla linearità della storia e del gameplay "

Hero of the Kingdom II è all'incirca lo stesso gioco, cambia l'ambientazione e la trama ma la maggior parte degli asset e delle meccaniche sono prese direttamente dal primo capitolo, nonostante questo il gioco non risulta affatto noioso o ripetitivo ma anzi migliora alcune delle caratteristiche del suo predecessore.
Se vi è piaciuto il primo capitolo della saga vi consiglio vivamente Hero of the Kingdom II, se invece non avete mai giocato a nessuno dei due vi consiglio di provare la demo (indifferentemente del primo o del secondo capitolo) per farvi un'idea sul gioco e magari cogliere l'occasione di acquistarli ai prossimi saldi di Steam !

[h1]8.75/10[/h1]
Degno successore del primo capitolo, di cui migliora alcune caratteristiche

14785714.review:
I’m pleasantly surprised by how entertaining and charming Hero of the Kingdom 2 was. It’s a short, casual game that’s a unique blend between the genres of [b]lite-RPG[/b] and [b]hidden object game[/b]. I’ve never played anything like it, and I think the developers have a great casual game formula going. Basically, your hero explores the countryside, a city, and neighboring islands while helping residents and gathering items and money in order to complete the main goal of saving the hero’s sister. It’s a delightful, family-friendly game and while I would recommend it to anyone who likes casual adventure games, I think Hero of the Kingdom 2 is especially good for young children. 

Keep in mind that the RPG elements in the game are very LITE – so, if you’re after a more traditional cRPG experience, this isn’t quite the game for you. While your hero learns skills, there are no stat allocations, nor can your hero make any choices that can alter their adventure. Also, combat is very simple – if you have the required items needed to initiate combat, you WILL win. 

Another warning is that Hero of the Kingdom 2 will only take a few hours to complete (it took me 4 hours). While the actual gameplay mechanics are delightful, and while the game appears very polished (the musical score is particularly high-quality), it’s far from being a cost-efficient game on Steam. The price/time element is definitely something to consider here, considering that there are many <$10 games that you can buy which can provide at least 50 hours of gameplay. 

If/when the developers work on Hero of the Kingdom 3, I would like to see minor interface improvements (for example, I believe that the hero’s health and gold amounts should be visible at all times). Most importantly, the developers need to work on storytelling and refining sentence structure. Here’s a snippet of game text:

“The workers did a good job. But they should work with tools more carefully. They have broken my saw.”

I wish the developers the best of luck with Hero of the Kingdom 3, as they’re innovating casual gaming, but I also hope that the future game text is presented with more polish and professionalism.

14751085.review:
Basically, if you enjoyed Hero of the Kingdom I, this is more of the same, and when I mean more of the same, I [i]really[/i] mean more of the same.  The gameplay structure is mostly untouched, as is the UI/map/sound/etc. and that isn't really a bad thing here.  This series is a causal resource-management set of games and the familiarity between titles makes it very easy to jump right into this.  You'll be collecting x amount of items y and z so the miller's wife can sell you bread without skipping a beat.

The story is super generic fantasy and comes with a stiff English translation.  The visuals are very nice and the style really works well.  There are no annoying technical issues or gimmick gameplay bits to get in the way of you fetch-questing for the rest of the kingdom. 

There are a couple of downsides, though.  HotKII is a bit longer than the first game, but this is mainly because item amount requirements can get kind of sizable and repetitive at times.  Building the boat is probably the biggest example of this.  The other problem I had is that there is some pixel-hunting required at times for items that don't visually "pop" from the rest of the art and don't have an "action" command signposting them.  There's only a couple of instances of you having to do this to progress but it can be quite annoying when you can't find the blacksmith's toolbox or whatever since it's super tiny and just blends into the background without doing anything in particular to draw your eye to it.

In short, if you liked the first game, you should probably pick this up.  If you've never played the first one and find this in a bundle a year from now, it's a nice, little resource management game where you can't find yourself in a fail state and is oddly relaxing and addicting to play.  It'll take about five hours or so to see everything there is to see but it's an enjoyable, light game that is ideal for zoning out and chilling.

One last thing, you can continue playing after beating the game, so unlike the first one, there's no worry about a point of no return.

14713112.review:
[h1]Popis hry[/h1]
Člověk si občas potřebuje odpočinout od toho všeho zabíjení, taktizování, závodění apod. a hledá nějakou jednoduchou a přesto zábavnou "hříčku". V ten moment je nejlepší mrknout na indie scénu. Při troše hledání zde naleznete spoustu klenotů. A ano, tahle hra patří mezi ně.

Jak už název napovídá, je tohle pokračování prvního dílu v trilogii (tvůrci plánují vydat třetí díl, ale jelikož tenhle vyšel teprve nedávno, je vše ještě skryto v mlze), který byl parádním odreagováním.

Hru je velice těžké popsat, ale i tak se o to pokusím. Plníte jednoduché úkoly (je tu i spousta vedlejších), kdy máte někomu něco přinést či vyrobit. Vyděláváte si peníze, získáváte slávu a může to působit jako takové RPG, ale zdání v tomto případě klame. Hra je díky své jednoduchosti vhodná i pro děti. Není tu ani kapka krve, ani sprostá slova, ani nic, co by je snad mělo pohoršit. Pokud vám tedy nevadí zabíjení hadů, pavouků, zombíků a podobné havěti...

Postupem hrou si také zpřístupníte různé dovednosti, jako je sběr hub, ptačích vajíček nebo třeba hledání perel. A zde to začíná být už o něco zajímavější. Na každé krásně detailně zpracované oblasti se nachází poschovávány tyhle věci a vy je můžete najít a vydělat si tak dost peněz. Trochu to připomíná HOG hry a neuvěřitelně to baví. Hra je díky tomu všemu chytlavá a po jejím dokončení budete chtít více.

Ano, můžete sáhnout po prvním díle. Druhý poté jako správné pokračování pozvedl vše na vyšší úroveň, a tak vás zabaví o pár hodin víc. Bohužel po dokončení hry (případně dodělání všech achievementů, které jsou zde lehoučké) vám nezbude nic jiného, než čekat na třetí díl. Hra podobného mixu žánrů a kvalit totiž neexistuje.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ detailní grafické zpracování
+ hledání skrytých předmětů (konkrétně lastur, krabů, beden, hřibů, vajíček a perel)
+ hromada vedlejších úkolů
+ spousta vedlejších aktivit (hledání pokladů, páčení zámků, lov zvěře)
+ vhodné pro jakoukoliv věkovou kategorii
+ hudba dolaďující atmosféru
+ integrace achievementů přímo do hry (taková drobnost, která ale některé potěší, protože můžete sledovat postup u achivementů ohledně sbírání)
+ po skončení hry je možno pokračovat dál v hraní a získat tak zbylé achievementy a dokončit úkoly
+ délka hry (cca 7,7 hodin u mě)
+ cena
+ čeština (kterou jsem mimochodem vytvořil já... :D)

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
-i když příběh nabízí pár zvratů, stále je céčkový a snadno předvídatelný (což není zas tak velké mínus, pokud tuhle hru hraje někdo mladší)
- hudba je jen jedna opakující se smyčka (mohlo tu být více skladeb)
- občas mě přišla hra až příliš rozmáchlá, měl jsem rozjeto i deset úkolů najednou a netušil, co mám udělat nejdřív, navíc peníze tu celkem rychle ubývají... :D (tohle je ale DOST subjektivní)
- ta hra je tak chytlavá, že ji ani nebudete chtít vypnout :D

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 9/10[/b]

Je škoda, že oba dva díly jsou jediné svého druhu. Jsou totiž neskutečně chytlavé a na odpočinek jako dělané. Také stojí za zmínku to, že obě dvě hry byly vyrobeny slovenským studiem, tudíž jejich nákupem podpoříte domácí scénu. Pokud máte, stejně jako já, rádi HOG hry od parádního Artifex Mundi, kupte si i tenhle skvost. Ano, je to něco naprosto jiného a nevídaného, ale dokážu ocenit originalitu a perfektní skloubení nápadů do jednoho funkčního celku. Kdyby mi před hraním prvního dílu někdo řekl, že vytvoří casual "RPG" s prvky HOG, vysmál bych se mu. Ale musím uznat, že se jim to skutečně povedlo. Tleskám tvůrcům a doufám, že třetí díl vyjde co nejdříve :D

14708601.review:
Dvojka se drží hratelnosti původní hry. Takže je opět potřeba získat slávu, najít všechny potřebné věci a proniknout do ekonomiky hry. A že bude potřeba dostatek peněz!!!

Nové prostředí přináší nové nepřátele, v podobě tropické havěti hadů, pavouků atd... Jsou zde piráti, objeví se i nějaká ta loď a hledání pokladů. Je tu i nová schopnost páčení zámků, ale schopnosti oproti minule byly zjednodušeny.  Dřív bylo potřeba jednu schopnost vylepšit až na třetí úroveň, nyní už tomu tak není. 

Příběh je opět o záchraně rodinného příslušníka, spasení království a poražení velkého zla, jak tomu bylo i v prvním díle. Vše se drží pohádkové atmosféry kdy dobro zvítězí nad zlem. Jen jsou zde navíc prvky fantasy v podobě nemrtvých, nekromanta, démonů atd...

Jinak ale je to opět stejná pohodová hra jako původní hra. Koho bavila jednička, tak si určitě dá novou porci dobrodružství, je třeba i zmínit fakt že se hra prodává za velmi nízkou cenu.

14693427.review:
[h1]Новое королевство, новая история[/h1]

Hero of the Kingdom II - отличная игра, совмещающая в себе ролевую игру и казуалку в жанре point&click. Игра не производит должного впечатления на скриншотах, но вот чего у нее точно не отнять, так это интересного геймплея (хоть и не без "пиксель-хантинга", который может некоторым не понравиться). Приключение стало чуть более продолжительным, если сравнивать с первой частью, квестов также стало побольше, да и содержание их стало поинтереснее. Сюжетно игра почти никак не связана с первой Hero of the Kingdom, хотя в диалогах упоминаются события первой части, что намекает на то, что события обоих игр происходят в одном мире.

[i]В целом можно сказать, что сиквел получился удачным. Игру советую все поклонникам первой части (коим я тоже являюсь), а также тем, кто ищет простенькую, но интересную игру на пару вечеров. p.s. Жду Hero of the Kingdom III. 7,5/10[/i]

14690387.review:
クリックゲーを超越したクリックオンリーゲー。難しい操作や素早い操作の類は一切存在しません。ただひたすらに画面内をクリックするだけの簡単なゲームです。まったりと絵本を読むような感覚でプレイするゲームだと思います。おすすめとしてレビューを書いていますが、そういったゲームを退屈だと感じる人には一切おすすめできません。
　最初は小さな漁村から始まります。釣りをしたり果物を収穫したり建物を修理したりして困っている人を助けていくことでストーリーが進んでいきます。ただし誰が何を欲しているのかさえ把握できればストーリーを一切追うこともなく(英文をほとんど読むことなく)クリアすることも可能です。なおクリアすること自体は簡単ですが全実績解除は若干の苦痛を伴います。
　悪かった点として、大量のアイテムの売り買いを想定していないせいか、多くのものを売買する時の操作が非常に面倒です。前作のUIに一切手を加えていないのが悔やまれます。
　ショートカットキーとしてI: inventory / M: map / Space: skip を覚えておくと便利かもしれません。

Ce deuxième volet reprend pas mal des codes et des mécanismes de son prédécesseur, revisitant quelques-uns toutefois : j'ai regretté l'abandon de la progression des compétences en trois niveaux, qui offraient de nouvelles possibilités au cours de l'aventure. Côté histoire, on ne suit plus le jeune fermier devenu héros, même s'il y est fait allusion au cours du périple, mais un autre garçon dont la maison a brûlé et dont la soeur a été enlevée par des pirates, à la poursuite desquels il se lance (le scénario est toujours aussi bateau par contre, de ce côté, ça n'a pas changé... ahah, bateau... pirates...).

Bref, ce jeu n'a pas perdu son charme, ni son petit côté addictif, malgré une traduction française absolument déplorable (à éviter si vous comprenez bien l'anglais). Profitez des soldes ! ;)

14676501.review:
一見するとRPGに見えるけど、実はポイントクリック型のアドベンチャーゲーム。
ただし、それぞれの行動を取るのにHPみたいなものが必要（移動では消費しない）で、お金も存在するので、プレイしている感覚はお使いクエスト満載のRPGに近いと言う変り種。

イベントを進めるに従って各種スキルを獲得し、画面上で採取出来るアイテムが増えて行くのが面白い。お使いイベントや採取物を売り払ってアイテムを換金し、必要なアイテムを購入し、また別のイベントを解決する事でゲームを進めて行く。イベントの実行にはHPを消費するので、食料を消費して睡眠を取る事で回復させつつ進めます。

戦闘も存在するけれど、必要なアイテムを揃えて敵をクリックしてHPとアイテムを消費して障害物（敵）を取り除くようなイメージ。何が何個必要か、何が不足しているかはクリック時に判る。
ちなみにアイテムやHPが足りない場合、戦闘イベント自体発生せず自分が死亡する事も無い為、やりなおしは発生しない。この為非常にするするとプレイを進められる。気が付くと何時間もやってる。

なお、私自身は特に英語は得意でも何でもなく、普通ゲームは日本語翻訳版しかしないのだけれど、なんとなく気が向いて日本語版が無いこのゲームをやってみましたが、使われている英語が非常に
平易で判りやすく、（特に凝った言い回しやスラングも無い）暗号や謎を解くタイプでは無く、基本的にアイテムを揃えるだけのお使いアドベンチャーゲームなので次に何をすれば良いか判るので全く問題無し。英語に躊躇してる人でもお勧めです。

14668793.review: An enjoyable little point-and-click "game" - although it does seem more like a Story. I'm not sure if it is possible to "lose" this game, although it is possible to complete without getting all of the achievements. (A few of the point and click spots are teeny tiny items and not the bold yellow icons) I say it is impossible to lose because you can usually buy and sell all needed items - the only way I could picture someone getting "stuck" is if they converted everything to gold and used it at the Inn to sleep, converting it all to "Strength" hearts. 14668699.review:
Seid gegrüßt,

auf den ersten Hero of the Kingdom Teil bin ich bei einer Aktion gestoßen. Ich dachte mir: Hey, Retro Grafik, klassisches Rollenspiel mal nicht vom RPG Maker, nehm ich!

Ich gebe zu, der Anfang war erst einmal gewöhnungsdürftig, denn ich steuerte keine Figur, sondern ich erledigte seine Abenteuer via Mausklicks. Das war ungewohnt, aber zugleich genial. Ich habe den ersten Teil durch gesuchtet mit den typischen Heroes of Might and Magic Gedanken: "Nur noch einen Zug .... einen einzigen Zug....." Tja, daraus wurden (jedes Mal) mehr. 
Umso erfreuter war ich sah das es einen 2 Teil geben wird. Ich erwarte ja selten Spiele voller Spannung und ich habe nicht wenig Spiele bisher gespielt (Generation AMIGA :D ), aber Hero of the Kingdom 2 konnte ich nicht erwarten. Dann war es endlich da und der erste Gedanke war: Hmmm, andere Helden ... ach was solls, solange es Spaß macht!

Also drauf los und da war es wieder das Suchtgefühl das in der Lage ist, den letzten Schlaf zu rauben: Nur noch einen Zug ... einen einzigen Zug ......

Liebe Lonely Troops, IHR RAUBT MIR DEN LETZTEN SCHLAF .... aber verdammt.... dafür liebe ich euch!!!

Spaß beiseite. Hero of the Kingdom ist ein mehr als würdiger Nachfolger des ersten Teiles. 
Eine simple aber auch interessante Geschichte, sehr detaillierte Grafik, wunderschöne Musik und eine einzigartige Atmosphäre, vereint in einen wirklich liebevoll gemachten Spiel.
Man folgt der Geschichte einer entführten Schwester in der Rolle des Bruders und hat eine lange Reise vor sich. Aufgebaut ist das Spiel wie beim Vorgänger in vielen Bildern, in denen es Aufgaben zu erledigen gibt, incl. einen gut durchdachten kleinen Wirtschaftssystem, das fair ist. Ein Klickspiel mit viel Text und auch Wimmelbildelemente, denn vieles will gefunden werden. Und das macht süchtig.

Ein weiterer Ansporn sind die Achievements, die ich dieses Mal bei einen einmaligen Durchspielen alle, alle bekommen habe. Im ersten Teil fehlt mir immer noch ein einziger Pilz ............ den ich lange nicht finden konnte.

EIn wichtiger Hinweis, wenn ihr das Spiel zuende gespielt habt, dann könnt ihr weiterspielen und die Erfolge weiter machen. Ich mag mich irren, aber mindestens 1 Erfolg kann erst nach Ende des Spiels gemacht werden. Geht dazu zum Start des Spiels zurück und folgt der dort entstehenden Quest.

Ob ich Hero of the Kingdom 2 empfehlen kann?
Aber sowas von! 

Und liebe Lonely Troops, lasst einen dritten Teil folgen, denn ich liebe es, das ihr mir den Schlaf raubt!!!!! Nur noch einen Zug ... einen einzigen..... :-)

14664352.review:
[h1][b]Hero of the Kingdom 2 Review[/b][/h1]

Hero of the Kingdom 2 is a beautiful Point & Click game with some RPG, Puzzle, and Hidden Object components mixed in. This game is suitable for gamers of all ages and should have no problems running on virtually any system due to the minimal CPU usage. The storyline is well written and the hand-drawn graphics are amazing for the price.   

One of the best things about a casual game like this is that it can be loaded up quickly when you only have a small amount of time to spend gaming and want to have a little fun. The overall gameplay is very enjoyable and even at full price this game is worth picking up. 

[h1][b]The Good:
=======[/b][/h1]
[i]+  Beautiful artwork
+  Great storyline
+  Playable on almost any PC
+  Steam achievements & trading cards
+  No bugs or crashes
+  Affordably priced for almost any gaming budget
+  Combines several gaming genres to maximize appeal
+  Quality ambient background sounds and music[/i]

[h1][b]The Bad:
======[/b][/h1]
[i]-  Quests and goals feel repetitive which can lead to boredom
-  Low replay value aside from Steam achievements
-  Simplistic gameplay that fails to challenge the player
-  Short game[/i]

[h1][b]Final Thoughts:
===========[/b][/h1]
Hero of the Kingdom 2 is not going to get your adrenaline pumping or test your gaming reflexes and skills, Its not supposed to. That's what is meant by casual gaming and as a casual game it is a remarkable title that still offers a lot of gaming pleasure at a bargain price. I enjoyed playing this title and would recommend everyone to pick up a copy for their gaming library.


[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url][/i]

14662001.review:
Hero of the Kingdom II is a very casual and relaxed game. There's no stress, no time limits and no 'action' to speak of. It's entirely based around economic puzzles; gathering resources in many forms and bringing them together to progress. Some you need to spend, others stay with you. It's simple enough, with the real test being the ability to remember where and how to get what you need. For an example, remembering how to get hay when later in the game you end up needing some for a cow's bedding. -- And yes, that's about how the average quest goes. You'll be slaying monsters as well, but you do it in the exact same manner. "Now where can I get a shield, a mercenary and a torch to slay a giant spider?"

Even then, it's fun. It's very genuinely fun. I do need to warn you that the story, writing and dialogue are all awful. Sorry! :( I don't mean that as an insult to the developer, it's just the whole world doesn't show an ounce of actual creative thinking. It's a cookie-cutter save-the-girl quest in a cookie-cutter fantasy kingdom in which you face cookie-cutter pirates. If you want a story, avoid this game like the plague. If you want a chill, casual, resource-driven puzzle game, dude, go nuts. It's totally worth it.
