14659482.review:
포인트 앤 클릭 어드벤쳐 게임.
말이 좋아 포인트 앤 클릭이고, 현실은 그냥 잔심부름 반복하는 노가다성이 조금 있는 게임. 루리웹에 있는 어떤 분은 이게 전략 시뮬레이션 게임인 줄 알고 구매했다가 낭패를 보신 듯 한데...

이런 게임이 늘상 그렇듯, 게임의 템포가 한없이 느리다. 초반부터 주인공의 여동생이 잡혀가고 난리도 아니지만, 하룻밤을 자건 열흘밤을 자건 아주아주 느긋한 플레이가 가능하다. 더불어 나오는 영어 대사들도 전혀 어렵지 않아 그냥 초등학생/중학생 용 소설 읽는 느낌으로 플레이하면 된다. 전작에서 플레이어의 삽질로 돈이 부족해지는 문제를, 가벼운 무역(...) 활동을 도입해 해결해뒀다. 그래도 나름 전작의 문제점은 잘 캐치한 듯 하다.

(비록 전작에다가는 비추천을 눌렀지만) 내가 이 게임을 추천하는 이유는, 영어의 난이도가 어렵지 않아 적당히 읽어가면서 영어 공부할 겸 플레이할 수 있다는 점과 긴장감 없이 주어진 잔심부름 하고 맵에 있는 여러 오브젝트들 찾아 클릭하는 한없이 느긋한 게임플레이, 그리고 시간 대비 도전과제 효율이 좋기 때문에 추천을 누른다.

그리고 이 게임의 평가가 "매우 긍정적"인 것은 이 게임을 구매하고 플레이한 다른 플레이어들 또한 전작을 통해 이 게임이 위에서 설명한 그런 게임이라는 것을 알고, 자신들의 취향에 맞았기에 다들 추천을 누른 것이다. 그러니 단순히 내 평가만을 읽고 게임을 구매했다가 "어? 재미없는 게임인데 얘 사기쳤네???"라며 날 비롯한 긍정적인 평가를 쓴 이들을 쉽게 폄하하고 욕하는 일은 없길 바란다.

14656918.review:
Hero of the kingdom 2 is a very casual point and click game.

It has a very vanilla story, where you must rescue your sister from pirates and have many adventures from there but it is still surprisingly entertaining. The game is enjoyable and relaxing because of its pace. Often you will find that paying attention to the little details will help you in progressing in your quests. 

This game is not necessarily recommended for players that seek a hardcore experience for the puzzles and quests are based on fetching and backtracking which some may find tedious.

Still the game grows on you as you play and before you know it you've clocked in some hours already.

Pros:

Casual and relaxing
Difficulty is never overwhelming
Endearing story

Cons:
No quest log. Sometimes you forget why you had a certain item and where to take it to when backtracking
Can get repetitive
No replayability
Short.

14649366.review:
After I played the first one some time ago I thought it a good idea to test the waters in the second game. Catching it while it's on sale for release is a good idea. I finished the game with 5 hours on my steam clock, but that was also idling for about 25 minutes off PC. Is it worth the time/cash ratio? I think so. 

The game is identical in how it feels to the first game. Great artwork, tons of collectables, a relaxed soundtrack with a nice atmosphere for it. All in all the game really does feel fairly polished. There was a really annoying quest which seemed to ask for unreasonable things as it felt still early in the game however you can scrounge around testing your detective skills by finding necessities along your quest. I also feel like this one is actually possible to lose if you mismanage your materials before you get to a point where you could properly take advantage of all locations that offer a chance to make some money. 

There might be a bit more balancing yet to come however the game is definitely possible to complete somewhat easily. For the style of game I'd say the only thing it's missing is a way to track quests. I had to cycle the map a few times to remember what my quests needed when I was processing a few at a time. The only thing that really peeved me at all would have to be when buying/selling lots of materials the button to do so really has an annoying delay. Mind you extremely minor and in no way really affects the game. 

As with the first game there's next to no replayability outside of enjoying the story again. Adding to that the story is not exactly ground breaking or outstanding but it is detailed enough to at least give you a nice sense of what the character is feeling. With significantly more battles to take part in though could spend a good hour just killing things.

So if you can pick this up while still on sale, it's worth the small pricetag I believe. If you don't have a sharp eye you might spend a fair bit of time just looking for everything which adds a bit of it's own 'I spy' feeling to it. Rating on the style of the game I'd give it an 8.5/10. Could have been longer and would have liked to see maybe temporary areas with loot for one time chances, or map extensions and more quests.

Gdybym nie znał Plants vs Zombies to powiedziałbym nawet, że jest to najlepszy casual w jaki grałem i jej jedynym minusem jest to, że się zwyczajnie kończy :) Bardzo udana kontunuacja HotK1 zrobiona wg zasady "więcej, lepiej, bardziej". Widać wiele innowacji, które na szczęście nie są przekombinowane i nie "przefajnowane". Skutecznie urozmaicają rozgrywkę. Wciąga jak bagno i nie pozwala się od siebie oderwać, a do tego wpływa bardzo kojąco i relaksująco, głównie za sprawą przepięknej oprawy graficznej, muzycznej i sztampowej fabuły (co w tym wypadku jest na plus). Mechanika dalej bez zarzutów, wszystko działa płynnie, questy są od siebie zależne logicznie. System wyskakiwania achievków działa bardzo motywująco i cieszy. Nawet osoba średnio spostrzegawcza bez problemu w 7h zdobedzie je na 100%, a więc część rozgrywki typu "hidden object" nie przeradza się we frustrujące "pixel hunting". Gra się po prostu fenomenalnie. Kupiłem od razu jak tylko wyszła i nie pożałowałem ani pieniędzy, ani czasu. Już teraz czekam na część trzecią - oby była równie dobra, jak nie lepsza! :) BRAWO!

14631728.review:
I'm not too sure about how this fairs with other hidden object games but having played this as my first ever game of such genre, I can certainly see the appeal of the particular genre. Hero of the Kingdom II is simple, casual and fun game which I completed in one sit through (roughly 4 to 5 hours). It is certainly short and for the price probably not too worth it in my opinion.

I went into the game with a mindset of not wanting to think much and just wanted something relaxing and casual. Hero of the Kingdom definitely provides that. The story is simplistic with some predictable twists and turns but nevertheless the overall resource management present in the game and some hidden object finding makes the game interesting enough for me to complete it. The background music is nice and certainly fits the theme of the game really well. It varies accordingly to the situation and the different sound effects does enhance the story telling by a bit.

I would love to see the game ported to mobile devices.

All that said, I must play more hidden object games to see give any comparisons of any sorts.

I don't know what it is about this series that draws me in.  It has some puzzle elements, some memory game elements, some economic simulation elements, some hidden object elements, and some story.  It also has the very important: "Just one more click" element that every successful game has.

14629566.review:
In HOTK2 many of the resources aren't as renewable as they were in the first game. And unless you quickly grind (build low and sell high) you might have a money problem in the early mid game. But this is a casual game and the solultions are quick and easy. Curiously, a couple of the hidden objects needed to be subjected to some pre release testing. It's fine to hide stuff but at least make the object recognizable as the object it is supposed to be. 

But in the big picture those were minor quibbles. This game is as enjoyable as the first game.  But it is a tad longer, the game world is a tad bigger  and it has a number of unque settings that didn't exist in the first game. But HOTK2 is just a fun simple game to play. It sure is curious how these developers are the first to exploit this unique sub genre of RPGs and HOGs. Seems like this type of game should have been around for a while. But kudos to the  developers. I hope they continue to make many more games this this one.

14628828.review:
I played the first, completed to 100%, found it enjoyable, It's a point and click adventure game, I had no problem picking up the second, didn't hesitate at all, 
The second is just as fun, lots more reading, lots of random clicking to find things, 
The only problem, It's super grindy, It's like you need to grind everything to just pass one spot every time, whether it be fishing, picking herbs etc,
There aren't too many quests near the beginning, so you basically need to complete them all to have enough fame to continue, I found this some what repetitive and unenjoyable, I was constantly going from place to place to get more and more items for one quest because It has the last bit of fame I need to progress through to the next stage.

I played the first one without stopping, I couldn't, It was too much fun, the second however, I've taken several breaks, there's only so much grinding a person can do before it's tiresom and you just don't want to do it anymore, I found the need to complete things to unlock mushroom, eggs etc quite bad, usually you'd just click and it's unlocked, not having to do quests etc to get that ability. 

Overall, still a decent game and I'd play it over quite a few times, If there were more additions, I would not hesitate to grab, one of my favorite point and click games.

14612974.review:
[u]Hero of the Kingdom II[/u] не является прямым сюжетным продолжением 1-ой части игры,хотя в некоторых диалогах персонажей есть упоминания о событиях первой части.
Перед нами все такая же увлекательная Point&Click адвечура,которая несомненно заинтересует вас.

Плюсы:

+ [u]Сюжет[/u] - на этот раз на пиратскую тематику. Играть нам предстоит за юношу,чью сестру одним прекрасным днем из рыбацкого поселка похитили пираты,и само собой мы отправляемся на ее поиски. Как и в 1-ой части сюжет богат неожиданными сюжетными поворотами и множеством побочных квестов.

+ [u]Геймплей[/u] - нам все также предстоит решать несложные задачки и внимательно вглядываться в локацию и искать скрытые предметы,но сами предметы сделали крупнее и заметнее.

+ [u]Озвучка[/u] - легкая непринужденная музыка,озвучка персонажей и эффектов,все сделано на высшем уровне.


Минусов в игре я не нашел,разве что хотелось бы,чтоб игра была немного длиннее)


Итог: Неважно,играли или не играли вы в 1-ую часть,игра вас безусловно заинтересует,всем рекомендую к ознакомлению.

14603631.review:
First off this is not really an RPG at all.  It is basically a point and click puzzle game in a fantasy setting where you also have an inventory.  Almost all actions are instantly successful as long as you have the resources needed to complete the action, be it health or other resources.  There is little in the way of trading for profit though you can refine some items for profitable trade, but most of those take quite some time to actually make a good profit.

There is little in the way of replayability as the first time through you find most everything.  Camping is one of the biggest time sinks in the game as you will need to keep bringing your health back up.

As for the story it is a generic story and as an RPG it is a non-starter, but as a point and click aventure type game it is probably one of the best that I have ever played.  If you like the point and click adventure type games this one is a good one in a fantasy type setting.  The main difference is that it is 3rd person instead of a first person.  Think something along the lines of "Where's Waldo" and you will understand what the game play is like.

14598716.review:
This is the second in the Here of the Kingdom series.  This isn't a direct sequel to the first game, more of another story being told using somewhat the same engine.  From a look and feel standpoint, there are many similarities, but there have been some small tweeks as to how certain aspects work.

On first appearance, it would seem like there isn't much to this game.  But, when you start playing it, there is a lot of little things that really do keep the game interesting for me.  For anyone that has sat and played a game on Facebook or similar for a few hours, you'll find that this is just as valid of a way to spend that time.  Easy to pick up and play through, whether you have just a few minutes to poke at things, or longer to sit and relax.

Overall, I found the game to be very enjoyable, and worth the few dollars I spent on it.  Worth picking up.

14598207.review:
Неплохая игра-"кликалка по экрану", скажем, для планшета с большой диагональю была бы самое то.

Есть несколько моментов:
1. По-русски локализация несколько коробит глаз, т.к. присутствует множество грамматических ошибок, а перевод временами заставляет впасть в ступор. Если Вы не относитесь к grammar-nazi, то Вам этот пункт не помешает.
2. Квесты. Имеется баг с квестом "ожерелье", на начальной стадии игры, в первой же рыбацкой деревушке. Как только Вы наберёте необходимое количетво ракушек, тут же отдавайте сестре на ожерелье. В противном случае, для получения ачивки придётся начать игру во второй раз после получения 47 из 48 возможных ачивок в первом прохождении.
3. Следует знать, что "салют в конце игры" и "КОНЕЦ" - это не конец на самом деле, игру можно доиграть и дособирать ачивки. ;)

В целом, игра весьма приятна для прохождения.

14594939.review:
Hero of the Kingdom II, is a point and click adventure game, just like the first Hero of the Kingdom. Number II is more difficult than the first and it is  bigger  in comparison to the first game, this is from my experiences of playing both games and  I have 100% both games.

I have totally enjoyed playing this game, it to me was very relaxing and pieceful, but at times  became challenging but never frustrating, exspecially  when you loose your way, and cant find what your looking for, when this occurred it was time to take a break and play again later. You also must remember to barter and trade, i found buying wheat and getting it milled, then selling it to the baker helped me accumulate enough gold to progress, so if your short of gold this is how I found best to do this, but there are other ways to do this aswell, with other items you come across.

If you enjoy point and click type games and have the patience to play them, then you may well enjoy this game as I most certainly did. But i will say, that this game is not for everyone, but again what game is for everyone, it all comes down to personal choices and your taste in game types.

Also how long a game takes to complete should not matter, i did not race through to finish this game, i took my time and explored the game making sure i did not miss a thing and kudos, i found everything and got my 100% Achievements tonight. 

Also price wise, i believe its a fair and reasonable price to pay for this game type, this is my opinion anyway, but others may have differant views with regards to the pricing, there are always sales, so if your on a tight budget, and would like this game then wait for a good sale. :)

I'd like to thank Lonely Troop for this lovely game, i really enjoyed playing it. I will also look forward to more of your games in the future, and now i must chase those lovely emoticons for both games, they look awesome and i want them all, if i can get them all that is, Im sure i will. ;)

Well done Lonely Troops! Cheers from your Czech brother :)

14591558.review: 一年前玩到本作的一代，4小时通关解锁全成就，不错的剧情，相当休闲的游戏方式，并且官方说二代即将上市，自那时我就开始期待，但这一等就是一年，这跳票水平堪比暴雪……游戏最终在春节期间发布，第一时间入手并通关全成就，游戏时间比第一代长了近一倍。建议两作都玩，都是屌丝变英雄的故事，故事写的也很不错，打发一个下午时间是非常好的选择。

14591162.review:
When first game came out I never saw anything like it and was drawn to it very fast. Don't be fooled, this is not movement kind of game like Fallout, Diablo or similar, but point and click adventure, where options are mostly presented on screen. Charming addition is that not ALL of the options are presented and almost every screen has secret options and hidden objects. Which is neat, I completely like that about Hero of the kingdom 1. 

When I played it to the end I instantly searched similar games but those I found weren't exactly like HOTK1 so i gave it a rest. I was so glad that i stumbled upon sequel seaarcing for some casual thing to play. It is still great game but I kinda miss some things from orignial...

Pros (compared to first one):
+ a bit longer than first one
+ more diversity in the begining, and multiple ways to solve something (although probably multiple ways to get stuck as well)
+ has interior maps
+ more skills and hidden object types
+ maybe better story (but it is nothing special)

Cons (now i really wished that they really correct these in third, because i will pay double price just to play these kind of game, and there is really no reason not to correct these in small and charming game like this):
- story is still too short, too shallow for fantasy kind of game
- game is mostly text driven, relying on lines of text, immersing player into the world etc... but dialogue is still missing from game, or maybe better dialogue system where we really see chat instead of bubbles of text with "ok" on them
- reused graphics - ok, not that big deal, but they literally used everything they had in original
- i think they removed upgrading of skills (like hunting etc), for no good reason, so what you see is what you get now
- while i found that first one had lot of new things and opened new genre of games, here i don't get that feeling. And while I played original twice just to get all those hidden boxes and eggs, and achievements, here I kind lack that feeling of replayability. Probably becouse of next fact that is...
- no new content (almost at all)

But it is still great and charming game for own price. Not to mention that it was made by only 3 people and those who made music I believe.

14590360.review: Best pixel hunting game out there. 5 hours of gameplay.

14588114.review: "Hero of the Kingdom II" is a worthy successor to "Hero of the Kingdom."  The gameplay is just like that of the original game and it's just about a couple of hours longer (7 hours for 100% completion for the first game vs 10 hours for this game).  Again, it's a nice, relaxing game that you'd really have to work at to dig yourself into such a deep hole that you couldn't win.  Good fun.  The only semi-meaningful gripes I've got with the game are pretty trivial:  I'd have liked a rank system like the first game had for the main character, and a few of the objects we have to find are very tough to see on the map.  Other than that, I'm very happy with the game.  At its current $6 price, this is a definite buy.  I'd also say that it would still be a definite buy for anything less than $10.

Kiedy to po raz pierwszy odpaliłem nie wiedziałem co to i o co chodzi - pierwsze co ujrzałem to grafikę kupe jakieś miałkie dialogi a potem gameplay ... który  był na poziomie gry przeglądowej, no cóż miałem już to wyłączyć (na szczęście nie popełniłem tego błędu!) i chwile pograłem  i ... się uzależniłem :D

Gameplay jest masakryczni prosty - gra to RPG, niczym w klasycznych produkcjach jedyne co można zrobić to przełączyć sie między planszą  i - Gadamy z NPC'ami oni dają nam zadania - do tego na planszy można znaleźć znajdzki pokroju grzybów, jajek ptasich czy muszelek które albo sprzedamy albo użyjemy.

I o to cała gra - klikamy od npca do npca - cała gra jest liniowa i połączona sznurkami - jeden NPC będzie chciał 10jajek: wtedy my musimy przeklikać mape w poszukiwaniu tych kilku pikseli ukrytych na drzewach, kiedy już damy mu te 10jajek on da nam siekierę - siekiera pozwoli nam ścinać drzewa - co pomoże nam dać drewno drwalowi on zaś da nam miksturę która jest potrzebna strażnikowi - ten nas wpuści do miasta i tak ciągle - quest za questem. 

Jest to tak proste - wtórne - głupie - monotonne ale jednocześnie uzależniające (niech świadczy to ze zrobiłem 100% achivemntów co zajęło mi 8h - standardowe przejście gry zajmie 6h)

Moja ocena to dziesięć gwiazdek - klikało mi sie fantastycznie, do tego niska cena. Ta gra ma w sobie to coś

14580145.review:
Ich hatte bereits den ersten Teil gespielt und fand ihn recht gut, auch wenn das Spiel recht kurz war und die Story nichts besonderes. Darum gönnte ich mir auch den zweiten Teil.

Alles in allem, ist die Story diesmal ein klein wenig ungewöhnlicher, was ein Fortschritt zum ersten Teil ist. Auch dauert das Spiel ein klein wenig länger, als der erste Teil. (Ich benötigte glaube ich 2,5 Stunden für den ersten Teil und für den zweiten brauchte ich 5,5 Stunden) Allerdings stellt die Story keine Fortsetzung des Vorgängers dar sondern ist eine Eigenständige. Der erste Teil wird allerdings einmal kurz erwähnt und der Held dieser Story hält das für eine Geschichte ^^

Der zweite Teil hält an dem Spielprinzip vom ersten Teil fest, ihr müsst Rostoffe sammeln, Nahrung besorgen und euch ausruhen. Dann benutzt ihr die gesammelten Materialien um an Geld und Werkzeuge zu gelangen und erledigt Quests für      die diversen NPCs. Dadurch schaltet ihr nach und nach mehr Gebiete und Fähigkeiten frei, wodurch ihr wiederum mehr Geld und neue Objekte erlangen könnt um noch mehr Quests zu erledigen. Neben den herkömmlichen Rohstoffen, die er unter Einsatz von Arbeitskraft und Werkzeugen sammelt, gibt es auch noch einige versteckte Rostoffe, die ähnlich wie bei einem Wimmelbild in der Landschaft versteckt sind, dafür sind diese Rohstoffe aber gratis und einige davon sind viel wert.

Es ist problemlos möglich alle Errungenschaften in einem Durchlauf zu bekommen, allerdings braucht man dafür auch ein geübtes Auge und man sollte keine Quest auslassen. Der Vorteil ist, falls ihr das Spiel durchgespielt habt, aber noch nicht alle Errungenschaften habt, könnt ihr im Anschluss das Spiel nochmal laden und weiterspielen. Auch sind noch ein paar weitere extra Quests neu aufgetaucht, nachdem man die Hauptstory abgeschlossen hat, die dann noch kurz die weitere Geschichte der verschiedenen Charaktere andeuten.

Fazit:
Der zweite Teil ist ebenfalls wieder sehr schön geworden. Das Spiel ist zwar immer noch sehr kurz, aber viel länger muss so ein Spiel auch nicht gehen, da es sonst irgendwann langweilig wird. Wer ein einfaches Point&Click Adventure sucht, ist hier recht gut beraten, wer sich aber noch nicht sicher ist, sollte warten, bis das Spiel ins Angebot kommt, da der Preis im Verhältnis zur Spielzeit dann doch recht happig ist.

14576711.review:
YES! It's finally here. Been waiting for this from a loooooong time!

+ The biggest 'PRO' of this game is that it's [u]EXTREMELY FUN[/u] to play. It's relaxing, soothing, immerse, and most of all FUN.

+ [u]Awesome Story[/u]: It's about how a common village boy struggles to save his sister and along the journey helps everyone he meets.

+ [u]Casual, Fun, Relaxing[/u]: This is not a super hardcore game, just a casual one which will make you smile and happy! ;)

+ [u]World, Environment, Aesthetics[/u]: The graphics may not be top-notch, but the aesthetics are awesome! You are really transported into another world. You can feel the stuff happening around you, you actually start believing that you are the protagonist.

+ [u]Unique gameplay[/u]: It's purely point and click, but it's not like your common hidden object game either. It mixes hidden object, strategy, decision-making and RPG elements into one single combo and trust me.. it's worth trying.

+ [u]NON-LINEAR[/u]: Unlike the first one, there's a plethora of things to do and a plethora of ways to do it. You'll have to make many smart choices as to how to proceed. I don't think it's possible to get stuck, but the game might get extremely slow if you keep on making bad choices.

± [u]Sountrack[/u]: The soundtrack is amazing. But it's pretty much exactly the same as the first game. I was hoping for a little change/variety.

- There are *SOME* objects which are very tough to find, and it can get frustrating very quickly. But if it does, you can always ask it on the discussions page and we will be happy to help!

- There's one more problem with the game. There are several skills which are unlocked later but it is very likely that you will do things and never know why you did them. [spoiler]I killed tons of spiders and zombies to reach nothing but dead ends and no award. I kind of started thinking it was just a way to make me lose my gold until I unlocked the lock-picking skill after which it all made sense. Maybe a marker on locked objects stating you need to learn how to unlock would have made me less furious.[/spoiler]

This game is built on the same engine as the First one, except that it has some better animations/bigger sprites and support for different profiles/save games.  

[b]Be sure to check out my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/aciddrinker/recommended/259550/]review[/url] of the first part to get a rough idea about what you can expect.[/b]

Rating: 9/10
I subtracted a point from the original because of some more cons in the game. But added a point for an overall more non-linear gameplay.

14575918.review:
The Hero of the Kingdom games can best be compared to the point and click hidden object games of Artifex Mundi.  While there are no specific hidden object scenes, you do have to look for, and click on tiny objects.  Another similarity is the backtracking to pass obstacles.

  For example, a bridge is out, and you need three pieces of stone, a rope, twelve ocelot furs, an eskimo translator, and a toaster oven in order to repair the bridge.  You remember that there was an old woman in a village a couple of screens back that offered to give you her toaster oven in exchange for a potion that will treat her husbands ED.  You also know that a rural healer specializing in potions is in need of an attorney for his practicing medicine without a license case.  Additionally, you met an out of work attorney, who will take any case as long as you can provide him with five hundred gold coins, and a "personal massage device".

     Such is the recursive nature of this type of game, and although it can be frustrating at times, the bizarre Goldbergian machinations somehow appeal to my sense of humor.  I mean, there is currency in the game, gold coins actually, yet so many transactions have to be completed with some random item the NPC desires instead.  Imagine if you took your car in for repair, and instead of money, the mechanic demanded a live elk.  Such is the world the Hero of the kingdom inhabits.

     While I'm at it, I must say, this guy has got to be one of the most inept, clumsy heroes around, because it seems like every other time I use any sort of tool, it breaks.  Going fishing?  Oops. broke the rod, have to buy a new one.  Harvesting flowers?  Oops, broke the sickle, have to, wait, hold on, why did you even need a sickle to pick flowers?  Anyway, you get the point.  Mr. Hero is no Bob Villa, and if he ever asks you to borrow any tools, just remember that this is a guy who can break a piece of steel on a flower stem.

     In conclusion, to sum it up, to summarize, to wrap it all up, to encapsulate, to distill, um, I forget what I was going to say.  I guess if you like pointy clicky roundabout games, this is one and if you don't, it still is.

14574325.review:
[English]
Hero of the Kingdom II is a short but delicate puzzle-based adventure RPG game. You'll spend most of the time collecting objects, trading and helping people (solving quests), then complete the whole story within several hours (probably). The graphics is as smooth as the previous version; with nice background music and decent plot that are able to provide players comfortable and relaxing gaming experiences.

The difficulty is fair, not too easy but not impossibly hard. I personally spend 8 hours to get 100% achievements, and truly enjoy every moment figuring out the tricky puzzles and finding those damn eggs and mushrooms. (probably top 5 of my most-enjoyable-100% achievements games.)

The Improvement would be too-short game length and limited use of collections (you can either use them for quests need or sell them only). Also the plot is sort of monotonous, which means side quests are few, yet it is still very entertaining.

A neat and fun game that highly recommend to puzzle/indie game lovers and 100% achievements collectors. I'll definitely look forward to more future work.

ps. I bought this game with the 25% off price, but still feel worth it. :D

14574197.review:
I don't usually play casual games, but there was something magical about Hero of the kingdom 1 that just caught my eye, so I had to get it. And I've finished it in one sitting, because I was enjoying myself so much. And now we have the sequel.

[b]What is this game about?[/b]

Hero of the Kingdom 2 is pretty much a casual point and click adventure, but it has more to it, because there are some elements from roleplaying games, like collecting different resources, making multiple small choices and exploring new places. You play as the nicest hero of all heroes that ever walked the earth, spreading happiness and doing goodness around the world. It doesn't play like traditional adventure games, but it's the closest genre I can compare it to. It reminded me a little of these Fighting Fantasy books I used to own, except you can't really lose here.

[b]Gameplay[/b]

Well, you point, click and do magic. There are a lot of hidden objects through the game, so among doing different tasks for people, you will also be collecting food and anything you can sell, because there are many items and tools you'll need to carry through. Some you can find, some you can buy. Game doesn't hold your hand in this, even if you are limited to your actions, you can decide what to do. Whenever you find hammer in a barrel, or you'll buy it and waste money, that's on you. In addition to items, you use stamina to do most of the activities, and you have to sleep to regain it. Nothing is entirely for free, so you have to do a little bit of planning. Game's pace is just good enough to keep you interested, you are always exploring, there is always something new to do.

[b]Sound & visuals[/b]

Traditional painted 2D graphics are beautiful. It's a nice change from cartoony graphics many games utilize today, so you don't see this type of graphics too often. Because of that, the game has this timeless look to it. Music is decent enough to set up the atmosphere, even after listening to it for a while, it doesn't get annoying, and sounds that play whenever you do something are silly enough to become classic to me already.

[b]Overall impressions[/b]

I just love how naive, upbeat and positive this game is! Compared to the first game, it's more of the same, bigger, better and just as enjoyable. If you've played Hero of the Kingdom 1, you'll love this one too. Surely it's not everyone's cup of tea, but there is something charming about this game that attract people I would otherwise never expect to play something like that. 

It's not too long, a humble little game, it will probaby take you around 5-6 hours to finish it, but for the price, it's a steal. All those hours are packed with joy, so I say give it a try!

14569280.review:
Bei Hero of the Kingdom II handelt es sich um das bisher siebente Spiel der slowakischen Spieleschmiede Lonely Troops. Es ist der Nachfolger zu dem 2012 erschienenen und von dem deutschen Lets Player Gronkh bekannt gemachten Heros of the Kingdom. Das aus den Brüdern Jaroslav und Tomáš Kurčík bestehende Team von Lonely Troops hat es sich zur Aufgabe gemacht die Fortsetzung schöner, größer und abwechslungsreicher zu gestalten. Ob die Verbesserungen gelungen sind erfahrt ihr in den nächsten Zeilen.

Wir sind mit unserer Schwester nur knapp einem Erdbeben entkommen und streifen nun als einzige Überlebende unseres Dorfes durch das Land von Heroes of the Kingdom II. Als es Nachts wird und Hunger, Müdigkeit und Erschöpfung zu viel werden haben wir Glück und finden die Überreste eines Lagerfeuers. Unsere Schwester ruht sich am frischt entfachten Feuer aus während wir uns auf die Suche nach Beeren machen. Mit vollgeschlagenen Bauch übermannen uns dann die Strapazen des Tages und wir fallen in einen tiefen Schlaf. Am nächsten Morgen werden wir von einem älteren Mann geweckt der unser Feuer erspäht hatte und dann nach den rechten schauen wollte. Nachdem wir ihm unsere Situation erklärt haben bietet er uns an bei sich zu Wohnen. Er lebt schließlich allein und wir können uns auch als Entschädigung nützlich machen. Während wir uns auf einem dieser Botengänge befinden, überfallen Piraten den idyllischen Ort und entführen unsere Schwester. Nachdem wir uns um Heiltränke für die verletzten Bewohner unserer neuen Heimat gekümmert haben machen wir uns nun also auf unsere Schwester zu retten und der Held des Königreiches zu werden.

Hero of the Kingdom II ist genau wie sein Vorgänger ein Point und Klick Spiel für Casuale Spieler. Ein anderer Ausdruck für dieses Genre ist auch “Wimmelbildspiele“. Wir klicken uns also von Bild zu Bild, Gespräch zu Gespräch und Aufgabe zu Aufgabe. Ob wir nun eine Spur aus Getreide folgen um einen Goblin in seiner Höhle aufzuspüren, Fische und Krabben für das Abendessen eines Fischers sammeln oder Blumen pflücken um Heiltränke herstellen zu können sind nur einige der Möglichkeiten mit denen wir Zeit in Hero of the Kingdom II verbringen können. Viele der Questgeber bringen uns auch neue Fähigkeiten wie das Sammeln von Holz, das Bogenschießen und damit verbundene Jagen von Tieren oder das Schlösserknacken bei. Jede dieser Aktionen verbraucht Energie die mit einem Herz gekennzeichnet wird, sobald wir nicht mehr genug Energie haben müssen wir uns zur Ruhe legen. Dafür benötigen wir, je nach Schlafplatz Gold oder Essen. Je weiter wir im Spiel vorankommen, desto mehr Energie wird auch durch das Rasten wiederhergestellt. Macht auch Sinn da das Ruhen in einem Gasthaus mit Vọllverpflegung angenehmer und erholsamer als ein Lagerfeuer am Wegesrand ist. Aus unserer Reise durch das Land schließen sich uns dann auch nach und nach freunde an mit denen wir dann schwierigere Questen erledigen können. Arbeiter und Söldner können ebenfalls angeheuert werden,  wenn wir mit es mit einem Monster zu tun bekommen dass uns anderweitig den Weg versperren würde. Als eine große Neuerung im Spiel sind die Dungeons und das Verwenden von Fackeln zu Listen. Neben Schlangen, Goblins und Zombies gibt es in den dunklen Gemäuern dann auch Schätze zu bergen die wir an andere Stelle tauschen oder zu Geld machen können. Das Spiel ist dabei jederzeit sehr einfach gehalten und fordert lediglich geringes Management von Ressourcen.

Hero of the Kingdom II sieht aus wie die klassischen Rollenspiele der 90er Jahre. Titel wie Baldurs Gate, Icewind Dale und Diablo kommen einem sofort in den Sinn. Die Hintergründe sind vorgerendert, jeder Bildschirm wirkt handgezeichnet. Es strotzt vor Details, eine Menge Gegenstände gilt es zu entdecken. Die Sprachversion war zum Zeitpunkt des Testes noch Englisch, die Entwickler versprechen zum Release aber auch einen Sprachpatch ins Deutsche. Bei den Dialogen und der Geschichte wurde viel Wert auf Leichtherzigkeit gesetzt und es verstecken sich des Öfteren auch einmal Witze und Anspielungen auf bekannte Fantasie Klischees. Die Musik im Spiel ist sehr ruhig und stört in keinem Moment, sie unterstreicht eher noch das entspannte Spielgefühl. Mit einer Spielzeit von etwa 6 Stunden, über 24 verschiedenen Bildern und mehr als 1oo Quests bietet Hero of the Kingdom für seinen Preis von knapp 10 Euro mehr als genug Unterhaltung für ein paar gemütliche Abende am Bildschirm. Freunden von Wimmelbildspielen oder schönen und anspruchslosen Geschichten können ohne Zweifel zugreifen.
